We are no longer able to provide loan laptops to members of staff.

We would advise getting in contact with your department business manager to check departmental stock or to discuss purchasing spare devices. 

Please let us know if you have any questions or there is anything else we can do to help.

Kind Regards,
IT Service Desk

name: Account Closure - Staff (Resolution)
content:
Thank you for contacting the Service Desk.
Please be aware of the following information:

?  For those leaving or who have left King's...

o   All accounts are disabled shortly after the account holder leaves King?s.

o   A notification e-mail is sent out 7 days in advance of the expiry date to allow account holders to transfer any information held in their account.

o  Once an account has been disabled, we are unfortunately unable to re-open or extend it.

o If you believe this is a mistake and you are still a permanent member of staff, please contact HR urgently as this indicates there is a problem with your CoreHR record.

o  If you need ongoing access, contact a member of staff from your former department and request that they fill in the 'King's Affiliate Account Request' on our website: https://kcl.my.salesforce.com/apex/bmcservicedesk__ssredirect?type=sr&id=a3S3X000002jtwHUAQ and select the 'convert a standard account' option.

name: Account Closure - Student (Resolution)
content:
Thank you for contacting the Service Desk.
Please be aware of the following information:

?  For those leaving or who have left King's...

o   All accounts are disabled shortly after the account holder leaves King?s.

o   A notification e-mail is sent out 30 days in advance of the course end date to allow account holders to transfer any information held in their account.

o  Once an account has been disabled, we are unable to re-open or extend it.

o If you believe this is a mistake and you are still studying or have not yet graduated, please contact registry_services@kcl.ac.uk, unless you are a member of the Nursing or IoPPN Faculties, in which case please contact your faculty.

o  If you will be continuing to work with King's beyond your studies and require ongoing access, contact a member of staff from your former department and request that they fill in the 'King's Affiliate Account Request' on our website: https://kcl.my.salesforce.com/apex/bmcservicedesk__ssredirect?type=sr&id=a3S3X000002jtwHUAQ and by selecting the 'convert a standard account' option.

o For more advice on this please see the following link: https://self-service.kcl.ac.uk/article/KA-01799/en-us

?  Need to access your certificates?
Follow the below link for further assistance:
https://self-service.kcl.ac.uk/article/KA-01424/en-us

name: Account Compromised
content:
Please obtain the following from the caller reporting the incident

Personal e-mail (not the breached one)

Contact phone number (mobile if possible)

Ask if using VPN

Time and date breach was identified

Warm handover to Security (in hours)

If you block account please let the user know all King's services (including ID card) will not work.

User should fill in data breach form

Data Breach report form available here:
https://www.kcl.ac.uk/governancezone/assets/governancelegal/data-breach-procedure.pdf

name: Account Disabled - Refer to Credit Control
content:
Hello,

Thank you for contacting the Service Desk.

In order to have this removed, please contact Credit Control and check that your account is up to date with all payments. 

Please state your K-Number and Student Number, explaining that you are unable to access your account as it has been marked with a debtor code.

If you have any further questions, please contact us and we can assist.

Kind Regards,

IT Service Desk
Email: 8888@kcl.ac.uk Telephone: 0207 848 8888

name: Account Displacement (merge) - Sets Category & CI
content:
Which two accounts are involved?


One account will need to be an Affiliate and one Standard as we can ONLY source Affiliate accounts in FIM. So if one is not Affiliate please convert the oldest Standard account first before moving on.
 

Verify that the user has access to both accounts.


If the user is unable to log in to their other account, this must be resolved under a separate ticket before the conversion can progress.
 
If the user only requires their K number, Employee number and Email Address then please use the Source Affiliate process in FIM.


Ask the user if any of the following data/settings need to be migrated?


a) Office 365 Mail Box (Y/N)
b) OneDrive documents? (Y/N)
c) Filestore? (Y/N)
d) Other access permissions and AD Group memberships? (Y/N)


If Y to ANY of the above, assign request to Collaboration Platform.

name: Account Merge (Staff/Student) - Resolution
content:
Thank you for the email.

Unfortunately, we are unable to merge Staff and Student accounts whilst both accounts are active.
This is due to them both having an affiliation in relevant systems (Student Records and CoreHR).

In order to merge these, one of these accounts would need to be in the decommissioning phase.

For your staff account, this would occur once your contract end date has passed in CoreHR, and you would receive a 7 day warning email when this is due to happen.

For your student account, this would occur after you have graduated, in the September or the January of that year.

Once you have received this 7 day warning email, please let us know and we will be able to merge these accounts. Until then, you will need to switch between the two accounts depending on which is needed at the time.

Apologies for the inconvenience.

Kind Regards,
IT Service Desk

name: Account Registration - Resolution
content:
Thank you for the contacting the IT Service Desk.

If you would like to register your KCL account, please take the following steps:

(If you are using an NHS device please use incognito mode on your browser The easiest way to open an Incognito window is with the keyboard shortcut combination Ctrl-Shift-N for Windows in Google Chrome or Command-Shift-N for Mac in Safari):

Go to https://mfasetup.kcl.ac.uk and sign in with your knumber@kcl.ac.uk (Not your e-mail address).

This will then ask you to setup either an Authenticator app, or mobile phone/text verification method.

Please see the following MFA guide for further information (information in regards to office programs can be found on page 10) - https://www.kcl.ac.uk/it/assets/using-mfa.pdf

Once your MFA has been setup, you will then be able to reset your password via passwordreset.kcl.ac.uk, using your knumber@kcl.ac.uk, and the MFA you have just setup.

If you also receive a error when trying to register the account, please make sure you clear your browser cache and cookies.

Further information in regards to passwords can be found here - https://www.kcl.ac.uk/it/password-resets-and-management

If you experience any further issues with this system, please reply back to this ticket with a screenshot of the error in question, and we will be able to investigate further.

Kind Regards,
IT Service Desk

name: Account Remediation - Resolution
content:
Thank you for getting in touch regarding your account.

Due to your account being compromised/sending out SPAM emails we have had to reset your password and enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).

When you next attempt to login to your account you will be prompted to complete the MFA setup.

For further information and help in doing so, please refer to our instruction manual: 
https://www.kcl.ac.uk/it/assets/using-mfa.pdf 

The ability to send emails through your account has also been unblocked but may take between one and two hours to take effect.

If you experience any further difficulties, please contact the IT Service Desk on 020 7848 8888.

Many thanks

Collaboration Platform Team

name: Add / Remove SharePoint Site Owner - Refer to Self Service
content:
Thank you for your request and for contacting the Service Desk.

For SharePoint site ownership changes, we require the submission of a self-service form from an existing site owner.

This form will be found on our RemedyForce Self-Service portal and are entitled 'Request a New SharePoint Site'. There is an option on the form for making 'Changes to an Existing Site', and to either 'Add Site Owner' or 'Remove Site Owner'

A direct link to the form can be found here https://kcl.my.salesforce.com/apex/bmcservicedesk__ssredirect?type=sr&id=a3S3X000002HR3L

The form will then be sent directly to our SharePoint specialist team who will be able to make the ownership change as needed.

name: Aptos / EAS Reporting
content:
Some users still need to access finance data in the old Aptos system, and may have been using the existing ?EAS? reports to do it.

These have now been replaced by ?Insight? versions of the same reports. The attached documentation is to allow Service Desk staff to handle queries from staff who need to access these reports. Please note that the EAS installation has also been removed from the Software Centre.

The Insight versions also run against a SQLServer copy of the Aptos Live database, which is an Oracle instance. When the Oracle database is decommissioned, at a date to be decided, the EAS reports will stop working. This may lead to a small number of users contacting the Service Desk. name: Azure Alert - Activated (Triggered)
content:
In hours  

Please can we wait 15 minutes to see if the alert comes back up (Resolved), If after this time we haven't received a resolved ticket then can we assign the ticket to the Collaboration and IDM queue.




Out of hours 

Please wait 15 minutes for the service to potentially come back up.

After this point and if the service hasn't come back we will need to investigate the severity of the alert by loading up the Service Management Power BI found here: https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/apps/d80cf0f7-51cc-4e38-bb3e-c9e938be619f/reports/6b77c1f8-ed49-4bb8-81cf-0b0b8aa1930e/ReportSectionfe2a5292e4561e0f0487?ctid=8370cf14-16f3-4c16-b83c-724071654356
Under catalogues > Servers we would need to search the name of the computer
The computer name can be found in the Remedyforce ticket towards the middle of the description and will look something like this (mcwappadc01.kclad.ds.kcl.ac.uk). 
With the above example, we would need to search mcwappadc01 in the Power BI servers catalogue.
Here we are looking for priority, escalation hours and service manager contact number. 
If the service is a P2/P1 with a 24/7 escalation we would need to contact the service manager on the number provided.

Incident notes will need to be completed during this process.

There is further information within regarding how you can access emails using the modern authentication method.

name: Candidate Number - Resolution
content:
Hello,

Thank you for contacting the IT Service Desk.

Your candidate number changes every academic year. For the 2020-21 academic year, your candidate number will begin with the letter AB followed by 5 numbers (e.g. AB12345).

You can find your candidate number on Student Records - http://mykcl.kcl.ac.uk from early October, in the section called My Personal Details. It will also appear on your personalised exam timetable (also available on Student Records)

To login simply enter your k-number (i.e k1234567) and normal King's IT Password. 

If the candidate number is blank / not generated you will need to contact Registry Services / Student Services regarding this as the IT Service Desk CANNOT help with this issue.

You should email registry_services@kcl.ac.uk AND log a ticket with Student Services by clicking here: https://self-service.kcl.ac.uk/SignIn?returnUrl=/ if your query is urgent.

Kind Regards.
IT Service Desk.

name: Consoles connecting to Eduroam
content:
Thank you for contacting the IT service desk.

Eduroam uses WPA2 Enterprise encryption in order to access the network. Most consoles do not support this method of encryption and will not be able to connect wirelessly.

The best way to connect would be using a wired ethernet connection if the console has this port functionality.

Another option is to bridge a connection using an ethernet cable from your laptop or computer.

We are unable to change the encryption method as WPA2 provides the highest possible encryption on most devices.

Kind Regards

name: Core HR - New Link (Resolution)
content:
Thank you for your enquiry. 

Your CoreHR sign in is now the same as your regular King's login. 

If you are using a King's laptop, on the bottom left corner of your screen is a grey search box. Please search ?HR? and a website link will come up with a red box next to it. Click on this and it will take you directly to CoreHR. 

If you are using a personal device, please use this link: https://my.corehr.com/pls/coreportal_kclp/

You may need to try accessing the link in an Incognito Window. The easiest way to open an Incognito window is with the keyboard shortcut combination Ctrl-Shift-N for Windows in Google Chrome or Command-Shift-N for Mac in Safari. 

Please also ensure that you are using a Google Chrome browser if you are on a Windows device or Safari if you are using an Apple device.

It may be useful to clear the cache on your browser as we have found that this can sometimes hinder a login.

Google Chrome:
At the top right of your Google Chrome browser, click the 3 ellipses and select ?Settings?.
Scroll down to see the word ?Advanced? and click on this.
On the ?Privacy and Security? box, click ?Clear Browsing Data? and then select the period of time you wish to clear (the default is set as 4 weeks) and then click ?Clear Data?.

Safari:
Click on the Safari drop down menu and select Preferences
Click the Advanced tab. Select the Show Develop menu in the menu bar checkbox and close the Preferences window.
Select the Develop drop down menu. Click Empty Cache.
 
If you are having trouble logging into the system, please reply to this email with a screenshot attached of the issue you are having and we will do our best to assist. 

Kind Regards,
IT Service Desk

name: Core HR / PeopleXD - ITSD
content:
CoreHR issues should be assigned to the HR 1st line team, before doing this you MUST check the following :

If they are unable to access other services, please assist them with logging in to said service using our usual processes i.e self service password reset / MFA reset etc.

Once they can login to Outlook using their staff account, if they are still unable to login to CoreHR, please assign to HR 1st line queue.

content:
Dear 

Thank you for getting in touch with us. We understand that the global spread of novel coronavirus (COVID-19) is causing concern for all of us. It is natural that you might feel anxious about the uncertainty of the situation, and we would like to assure you that we are monitoring developments around the clock. Safeguarding the health and wellbeing of our students and staff is our highest priority, and we are continuing to follow the latest advice from Public Health England to enable us to do so.

We seem to have received a duplicate ticket from you. Your active ticket reference is ..........., which will be responded to as soon as possible.

Kind regards,

SED Director?s Office
King?s College London
questions@kcl.ac.uk
Student & Education Directorate Intranet
8.14 James Clerk Maxwell Building 
57 Waterloo Road, London SE1 8WA

name: Coronavirus Easter Travel
content:
Dear 

Thank you for getting in touch with us. We understand that the global spread of novel coronavirus (COVID-19) is causing concern for all of us. As an international community, many of our students and staff have relatives and loved ones around the world, and it is only natural that we would want to be with them during uncertain times. 

The decision to travel abroad is ultimately yours, but please make sure that you check the latest health and travel advice and have valid travel insurance.

If you are travelling outside the UK, please check the Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) website for the latest travel advice.
If you are returning to the UK, please check the Public Health England (PHE) guidance.
If you are planning to travel, please consider carefully the potential impact on your studies. You will recognise that it may impact your ability to complete your studies successfully if you need to self-isolate when you return to the UK. We will do what we can to mitigate the impact on your studies on your return.

We hope our message has provided you with some clarity and reassurance. We are doing everything we can to minimise any risk or disruption to you and are taking the situation incredibly seriously. 
Again, thank you for taking the time to contact us and do let us know if you have any other questions or concerns.
Best wishes,

SED Director?s Office
King?s College London
questions@kcl.ac.uk
Student & Education Directorate Intranet
8.14 James Clerk Maxwell Building 
57 Waterloo Road, London SE1 8WA

name: Courtauld - Password reset
content:
Hello,

Thank you for your contacting the IT Service Desk.

We believe a password reset would help to resolve your issue.

To reset your Courtauld password please visit: https://passwordreset.microsoftonline.com

The requirements for your password are,
- You cannot use any of your last four passwords
- A password must not contain your name/username or more than 2 consecutive characters of them
- A password must not be less than 8 characters
- Passwords must contain at least 3 of the following 4 characters: Uppercase letters, Lowercase letters, Digits (0 through 9), Symbols (~!@#$%^&*_-+=`\(){}[];??<>,.?/) but not the following symbols | or :. not | or :

If you are having trouble using this system, please reply to this email with a screenshot attached of the issue you are having and we will do our best to assist.

Kind Regards,

name: CV - Building Closure inc. Process for Continued Access
content:
Dear 

Thank you for getting in touch with us. We understand that the global spread of novel coronavirus (COVID-19) is causing concern and would like to assure you that we are monitoring developments around the clock. Safeguarding the health and wellbeing of our students and staff is our highest priority.

With most people already studying or working remotely, we are beginning to reduce access to our buildings from 5.30pm on Friday 20 March. From Monday 30 March, access to our buildings will be controlled through a restricted number of reception points and only approved staff will be admitted.

If you have an exceptional reason to access a building after closure, this will need to be authorised by your Tutor (if you are a student) or Line Manager (if you are a member of staff). Please ask them to send their confirmation to the questions@kcl.ac.uk mailbox and we will ensure this is passed to the relevant Reception Desk.

name: CV - Financial Assistance
content:
Dear 

Thank you for your email. We understand that this is a very difficult time and that the current situation may cause financial issues for you or your family and may even exacerbate pre-existing ones. 

The university is currently exploring how best to support our students through this period.  Please appreciate that this is a continuously evolving conversation, which also relies on updates from central government as well as other governing agencies.  

In the meantime we would advise students to do what is best for them and their welfare, taking into account what the implications may be for their housing and other financial obligations.   We can advise that the university is taking steps to put in place financial assistance and advice for students who have been economically impacted by this global crisis: 
	
* through temporary or permanent loss of work (that the student or their family rely on) 
* having to relocate or change their study plans at short notice 
* falling ill or  
* being otherwise financially vulnerable during this time and are unable access appropriate support from the State.   

Once this has been confirmed, we will be in a better position to advise you fully and assist you with your enquiry but please be assured that the university does understand the practical issues and concerns that you have raised, and this is helping to inform their response.  Please keep checking the university Coronavirus pages for the most up to date information: www.kcl.ac.uk/coronavirus

If you can already identify your needs and gaps in income we would advise that you make an application to the University Hardship Fund as soon as possible so that they can start to process your application: https://www.kcl.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/fees-and-funding/student-funding/hardship-funds/kings-hardship-fund

If you have any immediate concerns, now or at some point in the future, which are causing a financial crisis, please respond with full details of urgent bills and expenses with which you require assistance and we will assess your eligibility for emergency assistance.  If you need to contact us urgently please call the AdviceLine which we are operating daily, times may change so always check the website: https://www.kcl.ac.uk/campuslife/services/student-advice-support/contact/telephone

We hope that this information assists with your enquiry for now and please do not hesitate to get back in touch if you need further advice about your specific situation.  If you think it would be helpful to book an online consultation so that you can talk through your concerns in more detail please complete the online booking form confirming your availability: https://www.kcl.ac.uk/campuslife/services/student-advice-support/contact/online

Again, thank you for taking the time to contact us and do let us know if you have any other questions or concerns.

Best wishes,

SED Director?s Office
King?s College London
questions@kcl.ac.uk

name: Direct Access - Force Shutdown Resolution
content:
Thank you for the email.

In the first instance, please see the below steps to resolve this issue on your KCL SOE device.

Search for Command Prompt in the bottom left search bar of the device, and open this program.

Once this has opened, please could you enter shutdown (space) /s (space) /t (space) 0, and hit enter. (Please omit the (space) from the command).

This will then force shutdown your device, once you have powered this back on, DA should be re-connected, and KCL services will be accessible.

If you do have any further issues after these steps, please provide a screenshot of the error in question, and the service tag of your device for us to investigate further.

Kind Regards

IT Service Desk

name: Direct Access - Restart Resolution
content:
Thank you for the email.

In the first instance, please see the below steps to resolve this issue on your KCL SOE device.

Go to Start (Windows Icon in the lower left hand corner of your screen), select the Power  button, and then select Restart.

Please perform a reboot, rather than a shutdown of your device. Please see the following page for further information in regards to this:  https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/restart-reboot-your-pc-110262aa-fc79-1c33-7b00-c140ae3a6dac

This will then restart your device, once you have powered this back on, DA should be re-connected, and KCL services will be accessible.

If you do have any further issues after these steps, please provide a screenshot of the error in question, and the service tag of your device for us to investigate further.

Kind Regards

IT Service Desk

name: EUS Desktop - Confirmation & Clearing
content:
For each device you are expected to check the following,

1. Please confirm the service tag (Guide, Finding the service tag)

2. Point number 1 will help you determine the warranty of the device. If the device is nearing its warranty end date, then it might be best to send them out a newer device that we can assure works stably during this period. Once they are done with the device, we will have it returned.

3. Please confirm that the member of staff has a Windows 10 SOE device and it is on the latest tranche (Guide, Windows 10 check). If they are not on a Windows 10 SOE device then please make sure to recommend that they need to be sent out a laptop. Once they are done with the device, we will have it returned.

4. Please check to make sure that Direct Access is working (Guide, Direct Access check). If it is not and this was something that has stopped working in the last week or two, please follow the guide that will be sent out by Malcolm on how to troubleshoot this using the LAPSADMIN service. If after this the laptop still does not have direct access, then please make sure to recommend they need to be sent out a laptop. Once they are done with the device, we will have it returned.

5. Please make sure to check that they can install the relevant phone software from the Software Center (Guide, Software Center software installation), the guide on installing and configuring will be sent out by Lawrence. Please also make sure that all pending updates within the software centre are completed. If after your checks the laptop is not able to install software and/or update pending ?Updates? in the Software Center then please make sure to recommend they need to be sent out a laptop. Once they are done with the device, we will have it returned.

6. Please make sure that the laptop is able to complete a group policy update (Guide, GP update). If the group policy updates come back as completely failed, please make sure to recommend they need to be sent out a laptop. Once they are done with the device, we will have it returned.

7. Please make sure to complete a full Windows Update (Guide, Running Windows update). If this fails and please make sure to recommend, they need to be sent a laptop. Once they are done with the device, we will have it returned.

8. Please make sure to complete a BIOS update. remembering to ?suspend? BitLocker before doing this.

All the above needs to be done to make sure that the member of staff goes into Confirmation and Clearing with a working device.  Making sure they have the most up to date software, to not only make sure that they are not interrupted with prompts for software updates, but also to make sure that the laptop is running as stable and efficient as possible. By doing the above before this critical period We will ensure that there are as few as interruptions as possible. It is best left to your train judgement on which of those you attempt more than once before you sign off that the feature doesn't work, or the laptop isn't fit for purpose.

If the member of staff has a Plantronic 5220 headset that has already been provided to them, please make sure to have them plug this into the laptop and check that the member of staff is able to hear you and you are able to hear them. 

For all Guides please follow this link https://emckclac-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/sttb1144_kcl_ac_uk/EmFM9ZSqu0NNgJkXFSbl2fABS0piWL-yHd9mYX6dH6uEoQ?e=VFm8fN

name: Forgotten Password - Resolution
content:
Thank you for contacting the IT Service Desk.

We believe a password reset would help to resolve your issue.

To reset your password please go to https://passwordreset.kcl.ac.uk - your Username is your knumber@kcl.ac.uk 

The requirements for your password are a minimum of 12 characters and it must contain 3 of the following:

Lower case letter,
Upper case letter,
Number.

You must also not use your name, common words or symbols in your password. It also cannot be the same as your previous password.

If you are having trouble using this system, please reply to this email with a screenshot attached of the issue you are having and we will do our best to assist.

Kind Regards,
IT Service Desk

* Nagios Alert Details

name: GitHub Login Error
content:
Ensure the customer is using our domain URL github.kcl.ac.uk/login.

When they log in and they get the error message ?Invalid LDAP login credentials?, this indicates that an incorrect account or password has been used.

All KCL users can access GitHub Enterprise with their ?k? accounts.

The username must be only the ?k? number:

Username k1234567 will work.
Username k1234567@kcl.ac.uk will fail even if the password is correct.

If the user still cannot log in, please advise them to reset their password and try again following the rules above.

If unsuccessful please escalate to compute & storage

name: GKT Alumni Account - Decommission
content:
GKT Alumni account will be decommissioned on 16th Jan 2023. These accounts end in @gktalumni.net

It is not possible to extend these accounts. If the customer has a very strong business case that justifies them being an affiliate then they can be referred however this is unlikely as the GKT accounts are only for emails.

A generic email (not resolution) can be sent to customers if they would like clarification about what to do. Please do not send this if the customer needs specific instructions that are not covered by the below template.



Hello,

As you have been made aware, the GKT Alumni Email Service will be discontinued on 16th January 2023. Please note, you will not be able to access your @gktalumni.net email account after this date.

What you need to do:

We recommend that you contact everyone who uses your GKT alumni email address before 16th January 2023, providing them with an alternative email address with which to contact you.


Saving your existing emails:

Emails can be saved to a personal OneDrive rather than forwarding them individually to your personal/work email address. This would allow these emails to be kept past the date of the account expiration.

In order to upload them to OneDrive, please complete the following steps:

Sign in to OneDrive and the Outlook app
From the Outlook app you can drag emails over to OneDrive
This will upload the desired emails to OneDrive
If you require any assistance with saving existing emails to OneDrive, please let us know by either replying to this email or calling the Service Desk on +44 (0)20 784 88888, and one of our Analysts will be happy to assist you.

Enquiries around email address as an alumni benefit can be directed to forever@kcl.ac.uk

Providing you with this role in the system will give you the same access as the line manager for these individuals. This would mean that you would receive all notifications, alerts, reminders, approvals etc. as a line manager would receive for all individuals as we roll out additional functionality.

If you require enhanced system access rather than Proxy Manager to People XD  e.g. People Partner, Management Accountant etc. then please let us know and we will send you the authorisation form.

Providing you proxy access for XXXXX would give you access to the following people?s Workgroups. [Then list all the workgroups for the relevant area.]

Please can your line manager reply back to this to confirm that access to all of the people listed above is required, please note full access to an area may also give you access to the workgroup you sit in as well as that of your peers and senior members of the university. Please let us know if any individuals should not be included in this access. 

If your Line Manager is away on leave, please request approval from your Line Manager's Manager.

Kind Regards,

name: Home automation connecting to Eduroam
content:
Thank you for contacting the service desk.

Devices that fall within the Home Automation category such as an Amazon echo do not meet the compliancy rating for Eduroam and will therefore not be able to connect to Eduroam.

This is implemented for security purposes and we are unable to change this for individual devices.

name: HR - DS - Affiliate user
content:
Good Morning/Afternoon/Evening,

Thank you for contacting the HR/Payroll/Pension Team.

The email you are contacting us on is your Affiliate account your Staff email address is: xxxxx.x.xxxx@kcl.ac.uk 

People XD will only work with your KCL Staff email. 

If you wish to, you can combine both accounts so that the Affiliate account can become your Staff account. To do this, please click or copy and paste this link: https://kcl.my.salesforce.com/apex/bmcservicedesk__ssredirect?type=sr&id=a3S3X000002jtwHUAQ 

This will take you to the IT Self Service portal. Please fill out the form to 'Combine multiple account types into one'.  

IT will notify you when your accounts have been combined and then you simply need to reply to this email confirming that this has been done. We can then grant you access to the People XD system.  

If you wish to keep two separate emails, then please contact the IT Service Desk for the login details of your Staff email. The K number associated with this is Kxxxxxxx.  Please send a picture of some photographic ID (preferably your King's ID card) to 8888@kcl.ac.uk  and IT will be able to provide you with the password for this account if you do not have it already.  

All HR emails are under a protected view to maintain confidentiality so please be sure not to cc the Service Desk in to an existing email as they will not be able to see it. 

Kind Regards,

name: HR - DS - Flu voucher provided
content:
Good Morning/Afternoon,

Thank you for contacting the HR/Payroll/Pensions Team. 

We are delighted to be able to offer you the opportunity to take up a flu vaccination with Boots the Chemist as you are not already eligible for a free vaccination.

Your details will be sent to the provider who will send you a direct link to your voucher. You can redeem your voucher at any Boots Chemist with a Pharmacy. 

On the day of the appointment, you should check in at the pharmacy counter, you should bring your voucher with you, but if you forget you should still be able to receive your vaccination. You will be taken to the vaccination area and the vaccinator will then complete a vaccination consultation with them and they will receive the vaccination.

Should you have any further issues then please do not hesitate to call us on 020 7848 3450 or email HR@kcl.ac.uk 

Kind Regards,

name: HR - DS - Password reset
content:
Good morning/afternoon/evening

Thank you for contacting  the HR team.

Your People XD sign in is the same as your regular King's login, please try this login before resetting your password. 

Please see new instructions for logging into your account below:

If you are using a King's laptop, on the bottom left corner of your screen is a grey search box. Please search ?HR? and a website link will come up with a red box next to it. Click on this and it will take you directly to People XD. 

If you are using a personal device, please use this link: https://my.corehr.com/pls/coreportal_kclp/

You may need to try accessing the link in an Incognito Window. The easiest way to open an Incognito window is with the keyboard shortcut combination Ctrl-Shift-N for Windows in Google Chrome or Command-Shift-N for Mac in Safari. 

Please also ensure that you are using a Google Chrome browser if you are on a Windows device or Safari if you are using an Apple device.

It may be useful to clear the cache on your browser as we have found that this can sometimes hinder a login. 
Google Chrome:
At the top right of your Google Chrome browser, click the 3 ellipses and select ?Settings?.
Scroll down to see the word ?Advanced? and click on this.
On the ?Privacy and Security? box, click ?Clear Browsing Data? and then select the period of time you wish to clear (the default is set as 4 weeks) and then click ?Clear Data?.
Safari:
Click on the Safari drop down menu and select Preferences
Click the Advanced tab. Select the Show Develop menu in the menu bar checkbox and close the Preferences window.
Select the Develop drop down menu. Click Empty Cache.

Unfortunately we no longer reset passwords to People XD through this mailbox.

You will need to contact the IT Service desk on either 8888@kcl.ac.uk or 020 7848 8888 who will be able to assist you further. 

Please note that you will need to contact the IT Service Desk via a brand new email, as unfortunately, due to the ticketing system that we have in place, your email will keep coming back to us at the HR Team.

We will close this ticket for you. 

Should you have any further issues then please do not hesitate to call us on 020 7848 3450 or email HR@kcl.ac.uk 

Kind Regards,

The HRDSS Team

To be in with a chance of winning a £50 Amazon voucher, simply follow the link from your resolution email to complete the HR Customer Satisfaction Survey. We are always very keen to improve our service and this is very valuable to us. Thank you.

name: HR - DS - Recruit troubleshooting
content:
Good Morning/Afternoon/Evening,

Thank you for contacting HR/Payroll/Pensions Team.

Please see our basic troubleshooting guide below. If you have checked all these points and are still having problems, please send us a screenshot of the issue that you are experiencing, and we will send this to our Second Line Support Team for further investigation:

Please note that our system is not designed to work when accessed through a smartphone or tablet. If you have recurring errors, we recommend that you try to login or register with a laptop or desktop.

Common browser issues:
Please ensure that you are using a Google Chrome browser if you are on a Windows device or Safari if you are using an Apple device. You might want to try an incognito tab on the Google Chrome browser if you are still having issues.
The password needs to be a minimum of 8 characters, including 1 uppercase character, 1 numeric digit and 1 special character (eg ! #) 
Please note that @, ' and ' will not be accepted as special characters. 

It may be useful to clear the cache on your browser as we have found that this can sometimes hinder a login or registration. 
Google Chrome:
At the top right of your Google Chrome browser, click the 3 ellipses and select ?Settings?.
Scroll down to see the word ?Advanced? and click on this.
On the ?Privacy and Security? box, click ?Clear Browsing Data? and then select the period of time you wish to clear (the default is set as 4 weeks) and then click ?Clear Data?.
Safari:
Click on the Safari drop down menu and select Preferences
Click the Advanced tab. Select the Show Develop menu in the menu bar checkbox and close the Preferences window.
Select the Develop drop down menu. Click Empty Cache.

Common portal issues:
If you are unable to submit your application or the submit button is missing:
This may be due to the required sections not being completed and until they are, the option to submit will not be presented. Please check that you have completed all required sections and if you are not sure, please send us a screenshot so that we can check for you.
The previous employment and references section requires a minimum number to be completed before this section is marked as ?complete? i.e for Professional Services job, at least 2 references are required and for Academic roles, at least 3 is required.
Also, the Professional Registrations sections is mandatory even if user does not hold any ? when they complete this section, there is an option to select ?not applicable?.

A common issue when completing the previous employment section is exceeding the maximum character length - please check the number of characters in the sections below:

Short summary of main duties field: 2000 character limit (including spaces)
Reason for leaving field: 200 character limit (including spaces)

The system should stop you inputting past this max point but on some browsers it lets you exceed this limit.  When attempting to save the page, an error message is displayed.
Should you be unsure as to whether you have exceeded this limit, please provide the text you are trying to input so that we can test this for you.

When adding information for an application on the Recruitment portal, the following file types will be accepted: .doc, docx, .odt, .pdf, .rtf, .xls. .xlsx 
 
Please note that users cannot use the following characters when naming their files: 
 # % & { } $ ! ' @ 
 
The maximum size per file that will be accepted is 5mb and the file name should not exceed 30 characters  

Kind Regards,

name: HR - DS - Recruitment Password
content:
Good Morning/Afternoon/Evening,

Thank you for contacting HR/Payroll/Pensions Team.

To reset your password, please click forgotten password button on the login page and following the instructions.  

The password needs to be a minimum of 8 characters, including 1 uppercase character, 1 numeric digit and 1 special character (eg ! #) 
Please note that @, ' and ' will not be accepted as special characters. 

An example of this is Recruitment1!

I hope this helps you. 

Kind Regards,

name: HR - DS - Update user People XD
content:
Good morning/afternoon/evening

Thank you for contacting the HR Team.

I can confirm that these changes have now been made and you can login with the following details:

Username: 
Temporary Password: 

If you are using a King's laptop, on the bottom left corner of your screen is a grey search box. Please search ?HR? and a website link will come up with a red box next to it. Click on this and it will take you directly to People XD. 

If you are using a personal device, please use this link: https://my.corehr.com/pls/coreportal_kclp/

You may need to try accessing the link in an Incognito Window. The easiest way to open an Incognito window is with the keyboard shortcut combination Ctrl-Shift-N for Windows in Google Chrome or Command-Shift-N for Mac in Safari. 

Please also ensure that you are using a Google Chrome browser if you are on a Windows device or Safari if you are using an Apple device.

It may be useful to clear the cache on your browser as we have found that this can sometimes hinder a login. 
Google Chrome:
At the top right of your Google Chrome browser, click the 3 ellipses and select ?Settings?.
Scroll down to see the word ?Advanced? and click on this.
On the ?Privacy and Security? box, click ?Clear Browsing Data? and then select the period of time you wish to clear (the default is set as 4 weeks) and then click ?Clear Data?.
Safari:
Click on the Safari drop down menu and select Preferences
Click the Advanced tab. Select the Show Develop menu in the menu bar checkbox and close the Preferences window.
Select the Develop drop down menu. Click Empty Cache.

Please let us know if you encounter any issues with this so that I can assist you further.  

Kind Regards,

The HR Team

name: HR - DS - View and download payslip
content:
Good morning/afternoon/ evening,

Thank you for contacting the HR team.
 
We are currently working on this issue with viewing the correct online payslip dates. Our team are still in the process of resolving this issue and this will be fixed in the August 2020 CoreHR update .  
 
In the meantime, please do not click 'View All', as this is where the issue lies. Click on the correct ?Month? on the left-hand side. Then click on the ?Full Payslip? tab. This will display the correctly dated  payslip. If you are looking for a different month, you will need to repeat this each time. 
 
 You can also download your payslips by selecting 'Full Payslip' > 'Print' and selecting 'Save as PDF'. This should then download your payslip with the correct dates. 
 
Our HR Digital Services portal has been designed to work best with Google Chrome. So please use this browser if you are not doing so already.
 
If you have any queries about your pay information, please contact the Payroll department: https://internal.kcl.ac.uk/about/ps/finance/staff-contacts/ppcontact

name: IA - Refund Request
content:
Dear 

Thank you for getting in touch with us. We understand that the recent Industrial Action has caused disruption for a lot of us and we would like to assure you that we have been doing all we can to mitigate this.

With regards to your specific query, please see below for the extract from our FAQs:

Can I complain or claim compensation for any possible disruption from the industrial action?
 
The university remains committed to delivering an educational programme for each student during any period of industrial action and it will seek to ensure that students remain able to complete their programmes of study and graduate as anticipated.

All reasonable attempts will be made to make contingencies for students to continue their studies without detriment to their learning opportunities and assessment outcomes.  

There is a specific claim process and complaint form in relation to the industrial action which you can start to use to submit claims for compensation from Friday 3rd April. 

Full details are available on the Student Complaints webpage. 

Please be aware that faculties and departments are unable to deal with any complaints, and these should be directed through the formal process.

Best regards

SED Director?s Office
King?s College London
questions@kcl.ac.uk

Dear [INSERT REQUESTER NAME],  

Request for information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000 (?the Act?)

Further to your recent request for information held by King?s College London, I am writing to confirm that the requested information is held/is held in part/is not held [DELETE AS APPLICABLE] by the university.

Your request

We received your information request on [INSERT DATE RECEIVED] and have treated it as a request for information made under section 1(1) of the Act.

You requested the following information:

[COPY AND PASTE ORIGINAL WORDING OF REQUEST]

Our response

[INSERT YOUR RESPONSE]

This completes the university?s response to your information request.

Your right to complain

If you are unhappy with the service you have received in relation to your information request or feel that it has not been properly handled you have the right to complain or request a review of our decision by contacting the Director of Information Governance & Data Protection Officer within 60 days of the date of this letter.  
 
Further information about our internal complaints procedure is available at the link below: 
http://www.kcl.ac.uk/college/policyzone/assets/files/governance_and_legal/Freedom_of_Information_Policy_updated_Oct_%202011.pdf  

In the event that you are not content with the outcome of your complaint you may apply to the Information Commissioner for a decision. Generally, the Information Commissioner cannot make a decision unless you have exhausted the internal complaints procedure provided by King?s College London.

The Information Commissioner can be contacted at the following address:
The Information Commissioner?s Office
Wycliffe House
Water Lane
Wilmslow
Cheshire
SK9 5AF

Kind Regards

name: Intranet unavailable
content:
Complete ALL of the following checks when the Intranet is unavailable:

-Start and end time of the outage

1. From within the King?s network;
-Check Intranet availability https://internal.kcl.ac.uk/index.aspx  
-Is the site available? 
-If not, what error is received? 

2. External to the King?s network;
-Check Intranet availability (for example via a mobile device) https://internal.kcl.ac.uk/index.aspx
-Is the site available?
-If yes, login.  Was login successful?
-If not, what error is received?

Other information: If we have a suspected Major Incident with the Internal or External Websites reported out of hours (internal.kcl.ac.uk / kcl.ac.uk) please check the following service status page first (Manchester Data Centre is the host for this), to ensure the outage is not as a result of planned maintenance:

http://status.zengenti.io/

If the outage is not planned, please use the below link to report it as a Critical Incident to Zengenti:

https://zenhub.zengenti.com/Login/signup.aspx

You will need to create an account the first time you access this. Once in, you should read the guidance available under ?What?s Covered? in the Helpdesk section to aid you when reporting issues.

During Business Hours, Digital Solutions should be contacted as normal, and they will escalate to Zengenti if appropriate.

name: Intranet Unavailable OOH
content:
Log this ticket For Issues with 
 www.kcl.ac.uk  - Internal.kcl.ac.uk - www.kingsvenues.com -www.kingsmathsschool.com

Major issues such as: Total outage - Server errors (500 etc) on multiple pages -Search not working - Intranet not allowing access - Security breach

NOT for issues regarding errors in content. Or Individual pages.

-    Wait 15 minutes. (if fixed resolve ticket as P4)

-     If still an issue Check Zegenti status to see if known issue or planned maintenance: http://status.zengenti.io/

-    -If not log with Zengenti (you may ned to create an account) https://zenhub.zengenti.com/Login/signup.aspx

You will need to create an account the first time you access this. Once in, you should read the guidance available under ?What?s Covered? in the Helpdesk section to aid you when reporting issues.

As this is Out of Hours you will need to log the ticket as CRITICAL.

Add reference to Remedy Ticket.

-  Zengenti will then work on the ticket ? keep an eye out for updates and add to Incident Notes. 

Zengenti will contact Digital Solutions staff directly so escalation to Digital only required under exceptional circumstances below.

Homepage errors or in the event of a major KCL/London/PR incident that requires emergency content please contact: Ian Meadows ? 07990 557393 - ianmeads@gmail.com

If comms required contact on call.

name: iPhone Apple Mail Setup Guide - Resolution
content:
Hi,

Thanks for contacting the IT Service Desk.

Unfortunately we do not support the Apple Mail app so we cannot assist with any sort of troubleshooting.

We recommend the use of the Outlook application which can be found on the app store.

However we do have some basic instructions to help you get setup with your King's email.

Please follow the instructions below:

If you have not setup an email on your apple mail before skip step 1.

1. Open Settings, select Mail then select Accounts and tap Add Account.

2. Select Microsoft Exchange and type in your k number @kcl.ac.uk in the username section.

3. Put whatever you like in the description and click next, this will give you two options 'Sign in' or 'configure manually' make sure you click sign in.

4. Then follow the sign in process for typing in your password and authenticating as usual.

Once this has been done the mailbox should be setup, but please allow some time for your emails to load as they may not show up straight away.

As stated at the top of this email we do not officially support Apple Mail so we cannot assist with any sort of errors that may arise during or after this process.

Kind Regards,

IT Service Desk
Email: 8888@kcl.ac.uk Telephone: 0207 848 8888

Your inquiry has been passed through to the IT Assurance Team.

Unfortunately it is not possible to purchase your equipment from King's. 

I'm afraid that this is not permitted as the laptop will have to be disposed of via the standard process as outlined in https://internal.kcl.ac.uk/about/ps/estates/request-a-service/Electric-and-Electronic-Equipment-Waste-Recycling. 

Apart from being contractually obliged to do this with the disposal company, this is also to prevent any data breaches and claims arising from any faults the machine may develop.

This is also outlined within the IT Acceptable Use Policy found here: https://www.kcl.ac.uk/governancezone/assets/informationpolicies/it-acceptable-use-policy.pdf 

The sections of relevance are:

9.3 
In normal circumstances, users must hand back their university owned computing equipment when they leave the university?s employment or on demand by the head of department, HR or university IT Services. 


I'm sorry that we are unable to help with your request.

name: JISC TLS / SSL Certificate Expiry
content:
Identify the supporting department for the service the SSL / TLS certificate relates to.

You can do so by using previous tickets in Remedyforce.

Note: Unless it is a system supported by Cyber Security or Digital Solutions, the expiry notification should not be escalated to their queue because they will be unable to process the renewal.

For central IT service owners, please assign to their queue and add a new with the following :

Please see ticket regarding the TLS / SSL certificate expiry for <site> , please raise a renewal request using this form : https://kcl.my.salesforce.com/apex/bmcservicedesk__ssredirect?type=sr&id=a3S3X000002jiasUAA . If the site is no longer used, please complete the same form to request the certificate be manually revoked, this will prevent further notifications.

If you receive a certificate expiry notification that relates to a service not supported by central IT please try to identify the service owner, email them advising that the certificate is due to expire on <Date> and that they will need to complete the TLS Certificate Renewal form here: <Insert Link Here>

Please escalate to Cyber Security if you are unable to locate the owner for a certificate not supported by central IT who will be able to advise on who the service owner is.

Once the owner is identified...
Escalate to the Remedyforce queue or email the service owner outside of central IT.


If you need to email a non IT owner, please use the following template :

 'I am contacting you because we have received a certificate expiry notification for <Common Name> which is due to expire on <Date> at <Time>.

To renew the certificate before it is revoked, please submit the online TLS Certificate Request/Renewal/Revocation form using the 'Renew SSL Certificate' option here: https://kcl.my.salesforce.com/apex/bmcservicedesk__ssredirect?type=sr&id=a3S3X000002jiasUAA

If the certificate is not currently in use and is therefore no longer required, please may you visit and submit the same form using the 'Revoke SSL Certificate' option. This will allow us to revoke the certificate manually to prevent further use and more expiry notifications.'

name: Kaltura - Upload Teams recording to Kaltura (Resolution)
content:
Hi,

With regards to the question about uploading Teams meeting recordings to Kaltura, please see some guidance that CTEL placed together for the delivery of synchronous events https://keats.kcl.ac.uk/mod/page/view.php?id=3299612 for some clear guidance for King?s staff delivering events. 

In that space there is a PDF document - https://keats.kcl.ac.uk/pluginfile.php/5993592/mod_resource/content/1/After%20your%20Microsoft%20Teams%20Session.pdf - that lists out what you need to do after the session has been captured using MS Teams (Stream). 

We are recommending that all videos be downloaded from Stream and uploaded to Kaltura - https://keats.kcl.ac.uk/mod/book/view.php?id=3065210 - as it is easier to share the link to the media in an unlisted format or even place it into a KEATS course for specific users to access. Stream is very limited, staff/students who did not attend will be left out of the viewing.  

Our current practice and what we suggest, is to remove all the attendees access or hide video in Stream (apart from admins), download the MP4, upload it to Kaltura, edit (top & tail, order captions etc) then share media link (https://keats.kcl.ac.uk/mod/book/view.php?id=4646894&chapterid=421434) in Teams meeting chat, through KEATS course or even through email list once ready.  

If you have any further queries about your Kaltura recording please contact your Faculty's TEL officer - https://www.kcl.ac.uk/study/learningteaching/ctel/Contact-Us/school-support-contacts.aspx

Kind Regards,
IT Service Desk

name: KEATS Availability - Resolution
content:
KEATS experienced some unexpected access issues between approximately 08:00am and 3.00pm today, 12th July 2022. 

If you were undertaking an examination or submitting coursework at this time and were disrupted, we apologies for any issues caused.

If you were starting or continuing an extended examination, typically over 24 hours, please continue with your work and you will be able to submit your assessment beyond the original assessment deadline.

Your department will advise specifically on the additional time allowed but it will sufficient to cover the disruption experienced.

If you were undertaking a fixed duration examination over this period, your department may already have been in touch. 

In these cases we anticipate that alternative arrangements will be made for the assessment, including rescheduling. 

Your programme or department will be able to provide more details. Where mitigation needs to be applied, it will be applied to all students sitting the assessment and you will not need to submit a mitigating circumstances form.

We apologies again for the issues caused and are investigating these further.

name: KSW Gym - Membership Cancel
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Sport & Wellness.

You can cancel your gym membership through your account with the following steps:

1.Login to your account (https://kcl.account.flow.onl/)
2. Go to Memberships tab
3. Click Manage Membership
4. Click Manage Membership
5. Cancel Membership

Please be aware that we require 10 days notice of a request to cancel before the following payment date, as stated in the agreed T&Cs. If you are within 10 days of your next payment date, you will not be able to cancel your membership from that date and your membership will remain active for an additional month.

name: KSW Gym - Membership Freeze
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Sport & Wellness.

You can request a freeze on your gym membership through your account with the following steps:

1.Login to your account (https://kcl.account.flow.onl/)
2. Go to Memberships tab
3. Click Manage Membership
4. Click Manage Membership
5. Click Submit Freeze Request

Please be aware that members are entitled to a single no-questions General freeze per 12 month period for pay monthly membership, or once per membership for 12 month paid in full memberships. Other types of freeze may require eligibility documents of appropriate quality to be uploaded.

name: KSW Gym - Membership Refund
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Sport & Wellness.

If you have read the Terms & Conditions and believe that you are eligible for a refund, please fill out our refund request form: https://forms.office.com/r/FQJDQm2fsp  

Once you have completed this form, a member of our team will be in touch within 7 working days.

Refunds will be made as credit on your account or cash refunds to your bank as appropriate.

name: KSW Gym - Opening Times
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Sport & Wellness.

Strand - https://www.kcl.ac.uk/sport/gyms/the-strand-gym
London Bridge - https://www.kcl.ac.uk/sport/gyms/london-bridge-gym

name: KSW Gym - Suspended Membership (eligibility docs)
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Sport & Wellness.

We are aware of an issue on our system where suspended memberships are not able to be reactivated. We are currently looking into this with our technical team to get this resolved.

If your membership is showing as suspended you will just need to cancel the original direct debit with your bank to ensure that no further payments are taken. This can usually be done through mobile or online banking, or by visiting or calling your bank.

To continue using the gyms, please purchase a new membership through the link on our website. Please also complete the Refund Request Form including proof of payment in the form of screenshots of bank statements showing any overlap or duplicate payments: https://forms.office.com/pages/responsepage.aspx?id=FM9wg_MWFky4PHJAcWVDViySVrv6ubxFpbS6eVqjZAFUQVdNN0pLUjQxV0ozSDdGUjJZVE5CVDQ2SC4u

Thank you for our understanding with this, and best wishes,
King?s Sport & Wellness

name: KSW Gym - Upgrade Halls Membership
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Sport & Wellness.

To upgrade your membership, you would just need to purchase the Student Peak Paid in Full membership through the following link: https://kcl.join.flow.onl/centre/kings-sport-wellness-strand-gym

The membership will be discounted down to £40 at checkout if there is a valid halls gym membership active on the account. Please ensure you are logged in with the correct account.

name: KSW Gym - Upgrade Membership
content:
Thank you for confirming you would like to upgrade your membership. We have now upgraded your membership from our side to peak access. You should receive the pro-rata charge to your account in the next few days, and will now have peak access.  
 
If you encounter any issues please let us know and we?ll be happy to help.

name: Library Resource / Journal Access Issue
content:
If they cannot log in to EZProxy/ LibProxy

1 You log into EZproxy with username k1234567 NOT k1234567@kcl.ac.uk
2 EZproxy does not like ?unusual? characters in the password e.g. £ sign, underscore, etc

If this does not help they can try the following workaround



In a normal case, as long as King's is subscribed to a resource, you can login by going to 'Institutional Sign In' - choosing King's College London (sometimes Kings College London). You will then get redirected to a Microsoft sign in page where you can login using your knumber@kcl.ac.uk and normal King's IT password.

-

Some e resources don't support login via King's username and password and require a specific username and password instead - you can find these here: https://internal.kcl.ac.uk/library/passwords

--------------------------------------

If users are seeing error messages like the attached, or an entirely blank window that never loads, when trying to log into library eresources, and you?ve done all you can and think the ticket may need to go to the library, please check the four things below if you haven?t already, and then pass the ticket to Collaboration & IDM instead.
1.      Clear browser cache
2.      Incognito window
3.      Choose the ?Shibboleth? or ?Institutional Login? option, not the ?Open Athens? option, unless the user is from the NHS.  Even though they get an OpenAthens error, they mustn?t click on the OpenAthens option and try to log in there, it definitely won?t work.
4.      Ask the user to log into http://www.kcl.eblib.com/patron/ - they go straight to the login screen and can try logging in there.  If that works, it may not be an OpenAthens issue.
If the user can log in successfully but can?t see the full text of an article or read a book, then pass it to the library.

name: Library Resource Access Issues
content:
If users are seeing error messages like the attached, or an entirely blank window that never loads, when trying to log into library eresources, and you?ve done all you can and think the ticket may need to go to the library, please check the four things below if you haven?t already, and then pass the ticket to Collaboration & IDM instead.
1.	Clear browser cache
2.	Incognito window
3.	Choose the ?Shibboleth? or ?Institutional Login? option, not the ?Open Athens? option, unless the user is from the NHS.  Even though they get an OpenAthens error, they mustn?t click on the OpenAthens option and try to log in there, it definitely won?t work.
4.	Ask the user to log into http://www.kcl.eblib.com/patron/ - they go straight to the login screen and can try logging in there.  If that works, it may not be an OpenAthens issue.
If the user can log in successfully but can?t see the full text of an article or read a book, then pass it to the library.

name: Life at King's App - Direct To Guidance
content:
This covers most queries for using the Life at King's app, make sure they are able to access it ok first.

They access the apps features by creating an account on the app with any preferred email address and setting up a password.

If they cannot sign into the app they made need to reset their password, there is an option to reset their password on the log in screen

(Found by clicking the account icon in the top right hand corner of the app - this is also the same button they press to create an account on the App)

The Life at King's app is managed by Education Applications only escalate if you have tried troubleshooting any issues first

(reinstalling app, restarting device, changing password on the app, checking issue is not resolved with the guidance in the resolution field)

name: Login credentials - Use Knumber
content:
Hello,

Thank you for your contacting the IT Service Desk.

When logging into the page/application please can you ensure you are using the following credentials;

Knumber without the @kcl.ac.uk & IT password.

If you are unsure of your password and feel it needs resetting then please go to https://passwordreset.kcl.ac.uk - the Username is your knumber@kcl.ac.uk 

The requirements for your password are a minimum of 12 characters and it must contain 3 of the following:

Lower case letter,
Upper case letter,
Number.

You must also not use your name or common words in your password. It also cannot be the same as your previous password.

If you do not know your Knumber then please reply to this email with a photo of some ID and we can send this to you.

If you are confident that you are using the correct credentials but are still having trouble using this system, please reply to this email with a screenshot attached of the issue you are having and we will do our best to assist.

Kind Regards,
IT Service Desk

name: Lost or Stolen Equipment
content:
PLEASE ADVISE THE REPORTING CALLER TO COMPLETE A DATA BREACH FORM

Is the individual a member of staff, an affiliate or a student?

If a KCL managed laptop, was it an SOE build? 
Did it have Bitlocker on it? 
(if Bitlocker is enabled then Information Compliance will not need to report this to the ICO)

If a personal device, what type of device was it? 
What data was stored on it? 
Any personal data? 
Was it university owned? 
Was it password protected or encryption enabled?
 
If a KCL mobile phone, mobile number:
Asset number (if known):
How was it set up to access the King?s network? 

If Portable media, what type e.g. CD, DVD, external hard drive, USB stick?
Was the media encrypted?
What data was stored on the media? 
Was there any personal data contained on the media?

If stolen, has this been reported to the police? 
Crime reference number:

If theft was from KCL premises, advise user to inform site security.

name: MFA - No Phone
content:
Runbook: https://emckclac.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/ESMdsd/KB/MFA%20No%20Phone.docx?d=wd322b63b6ac3468280a5bc511e45bb6e&csf=1&web=1&e=UXsUXV

1. Ask them when they will have a replacement, if they can use a tablet or iPad, recommend this first (may need to follow usual MFA reset process).

2. Ask them to email a copy of their ID in response to the ticket you are logging.

3.Once ID is recevied, delete from ticket and add note stating it has been seen and deleted.

4. Go to the customers authentication method on Azure > 'Add Method' > Temporary Access Pass.

Set the following settings :
- Delay Start Time - Unticked
- Activation Duration - 8 Hours
- One Time Use - No

Select 'Add' and make note of the pass code.

Copy the email template from the runbook above and edit the empty fields with the relevant information.

Set ticket to waiting for customer for 7 days. Provide new codes upon request from the customer and follow usual no contact process.

name: MFA Changing Settings
content:
Thank you for contacting the IT Service Desk.

If you would like to change your MFA details, please see the following steps:

Go to https://mfasetup.kcl.ac.uk and sign in to change your verification options at any time. Please note, if MFA has already been setup, you may be prompted for authorisation.

If you would like to change your primary method of authentication, this can be done by clicking ?Change?.

If you would like to add another method of authentication, or change the phone your authentication app is based off, click ?Add method?.

Please see the following MFA guide for further information (information in regards to office programs can be found on page 10) - https://www.kcl.ac.uk/it/assets/using-mfa.pdf

If you have done this and continue to experience issues, please get back to us, providing a screen shot if possible, and we will reopen the ticket.

name: MFA Fraud Alert
content:
1.	Use the email template ?MFA Fraud ? Further Investigation Required?? to recommend user resets password, and enquires as to whether they believe their issue requires further investigation.

2.	If no reply is received by next action date, please close the ticket using ?No Contact ? Resolution? template as per standard process. 

3.	If the customer replies to confirm that they believe their situation requires further investigation, please pass ticket over to Cyber Security queue.

name: MFA on Owned mailbox account
content:
MFA should be disabled on all owned mailbox's (mailbox that uses a Wnumber@kcl.ac.uk)
W account in AD should be member of - KCL Disable O365 CA MFA
If user is prompted for MFA on W account, ask them to remove the mailbox and add again.

They may then be presented with a popup titled 'Use this account everywhere on your device'
You must select 'This app only' in the bottom left for MFA not to be prompted.

Link to KBA : https://kcl--bmcservicedesk.eu29.visual.force.com/apex/KM_ArticleView?id=a3K3X0000022cwJUAQ&RecordTypeID=01220000000hBpfAAE&popupHeader=Global%20Search&standardLayout=true&calledFromForm=true&enableSelfClosing=false&isGS=true

name: MFA Reset ID Seen - Resolution
content:
Add a note to the ticket once ID has been checked e.g. 'ID seen and removed'.

Once a note is added, delete the image using the below methods:

click 'Actions' next to the Save button > Attach/View files > click 'Del' in the new window.

OR

click 'Details' on the top section of the ticket > locate image below the section 'Notes & Attachments' > click 'Del'.

If customer is also reporting their password is expired / forgotten, they will need a personal email adding to their authentication methods.

name: MFA Turn Off - Auto Resolve
content:
Thank you for contacting the IT Service Desk



Unfortunately we are unable to disable MFA as this is used to protect accounts that have previously been identified as vulnerable.



This has been added as protection for both your email account and other Kings accounts/data.



This can be setup to work even when offline and out of signal, and there is an option available after signing in to ensure that you always remain signed in.



You can choose 'Sign in another way' and then this should allow you to use the verification code from the Microsoft Authenticator app without needing to be online or in signal. 



If you have any further queries in regards to MFA, please do not hesitate to get back to us.

name: Microsoft Teams - Troubleshooting
content:
If this only happens on the application and not the web version, it may need to be escalated to EUS.

The following details would need to be provided :

- What troubleshooting steps have been taken
- Attach any relevant screenshots to the ticket
- Has there been a remote session?
- Are they using a personal or KCL SOE machine
- Service tag
- Contact number
- Location they would normally work on campus (campus / building / room number)

Potential troubleshooting for Teams app are :

- Sign out / end task in Task Manager
- Clear credentials in credentials manager
- *Office repair does not affect Teams*
- Clear Teams cache (Quit Teams > Windows key + R > type %appdata%\Microsoft\ > Delete Teams folder > Reopen Teams

If the error occurs for both the app and web, this may be a ticket for collab, please use the same details above.

name: Missing Files following incident
content:
Check for the presence of the User AD group prefix USERDATA i.e. UserData PS Store 02 Usr Grp G 
	
		
Open command prompt as the standard user i.e. K123456 
		gpresult /r 
	
IF User AD group exist: 	
Review the low latency problem by toggling the Offline files switch. 
	

IF the issue is identified as Low latency try: (this fix is being reviewed under PR) 	
Local Computer Policy --> Computer Configuration --> Administrative Templates --> Network --> Offline Files 
		set Configure slow-link mode to Disabled 
	
IF the user AD group does not exist then Group Policy should be updated and user need to logout/login: 
		
gpupdate /force (as admin) 
		Reboot 
		Login

If the issue persists, escalate to Compute and Storage.

name: Mobility Print - Resolution (02/11/2022)
content:
Thanks for contacting the IT service desk

The Follow Me Printing server, \\PWAPPPRN05 is now a retired service, this improvement is necessary as the server is running on an ageing operating system that is coming to the end of its support lifecycle.

The replacement servers that will provide connectivity to the Follow Me Print service are already online and ready for you to use.


In order to be able to print please do the following:


Firstly you'll need to remove the old decommissioned printer

- Search for 'Printers & Scanners' in the windows search bar on the bottom left of your screen.

- Find and click the  'Follow_Me_Print...'Printer and select 'Remove device'


To add the new printer please do the following:

- Click on the up facing arrow in bottom right-hand corner of the screen near the clock and click on the white printer icon. 

- Click 'View my printers'

- Click on 'Add printers' then click on the Install tab. 

- Click on 'Sign in to install' tab 

Your username will automatically be filled in, but you will need to enter your password for you King?s account. The select sign in and install will take a few seconds and you'll receive a message to say it's been successfully installed


Once this is all completed please try printing again, It should now work for you. 



To view a graphical guide on this process, please use the following link and open the attachement : https://web.yammer.com/main/org/kcl.ac.uk/threads/eyJfdHlwZSI6IlRocmVhZCIsImlkIjoiMTk3NTExNzkzMzI2NDg5NiJ9


If you are still unsure please reply to this email and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

Kind Regards
IT Service Desk

name: New Account Setup Advice - MFA
content:
Thank you for your email.


To setup Multi-Factor Authentication on your account, please follow the below steps;


1.) Go to 'mfasetup.kcl.ac.uk'.


2.) After authentication you will be prompted to provide additional information to enable MFA. Click Next.


3.) We advise using the default Microsoft authenticator app and pressing Next to continue. However, if you would rather use text messages or an alternative app press ?I want to set up a different method? at the bottom of the screen. 


4.) You will now be presented with a QR image to scan in using the mobile app. You can also select 'I want to set up a different method'.


5.) From your mobile device launch the Microsoft Authenticator app and choose Add an account. Then select work or school account. 


6.) On the MFA page, click Next and the page will send a test notification to verify that the app is working.


7.) Approve the sign in prompt on your mobile device. 


8.) Click Done to complete the setup.


Please find the below links on further guidance for setting up MFA on your device;


Link for setting up MFA - http://mfasetup.kcl.ac.uk


Alternative link for setting up MFA - https://mysignins.microsoft.com/ 


User-guide (internal - requires login) - https://emckclac.sharepoint.com/sites/ITdsh/SitePages/Multi-factor-authentication.aspx


User-guide (no login required) - https://www.kcl.ac.uk/it/assets/using-mfa.pdf


Kind Regards,
IT Service Desk

name: New Account Setup Advice - Student Records
content:
Hello,

Thank you for contacting the service desk.

We believe the issue you are experiencing with regards logging into Student Records could be resolved by performing a password reset.

To reset your King's password, please follow the below instructions:

1.) Go to 'passwordreset.kcl.ac.uk'

2.) You will be presented with 'Get back into your account'.

3.) In the 'Email or Username' field, please type in your 'knumber@kcl.ac.uk' which would of been provided to you in within your Registration sheet (this will be in your King's emails or personal email account) 

4.) You will then be presented with either 'Send a text to my mobile phone number' or 'Call my mobile phone number'. Please choose one of the following and proceed to the next step.

5.) You will then be asked to enter a new password. The following requirements are: 

minimum of 12 characters and it must contain 3 of the following:

Lower case letter
Upper case letter,
Number, 
Symbol (such as !,./?@)

You must also not use your name or common words in your password. It also cannot be the same as your previous password.

6.) After the password has been reset, you should then be able to use the new password to log into Student Records.

If you have any further issues or queries don't hesitate to get in contact. 

Kind Regards,

IT Service Desk
Email: 8888@kcl.ac.uk Telephone: 0207 848 8888

name: Newsweaver / Poppulo Troubleshooting
content:
In order to troubleshoot issues (e.g. newsletters not being received), the following information is required:
1 - Who sent the communication (Central comms / faculty)?
2 - What exact list of recipients was it sent to?
3 - Who failed to receive it? (one or more specific email addresses)

Background information: Collab team produces a small number of distribution lists that Corporate Comms use to send newsletters via Poppulo. Otherwise, we don?t interact with Poppulo in any way.

This is the current process:

1. Users of Poppulo log on to the Poppulo website, where they can create and manage mailing lists.
2. Staff in Corporate Communications have provided us with a list of ?lists?, each of which is based on particular membership criteria. 
3. The list data is made available for download at https://idmsupport.kcl.ac.uk
ewsweaver
When a user logs in, they are presented with the data for all lists which they are authorised to download.
4. They download the list (a plain text file of email addresses)
5. They upload the list to Poppulo and then send out the email
ewsletter.
