name: NLR Project (IN CHANGE WINDOW) - Customer Resolution
content:
We are sorry for the disruption you are facing. The intermittent Wi-Fi
etwork issues you may be experiencing is due to work taking place to update the King?s wired network across all our campuses and buildings. You can find out more on our Intranet page here:

https://internal.kcl.ac.uk
ews
ews-article?id=8576ce1b-5b69-4339-ab9e-8c7a9449bb0b

We have some alternative solutions to help you connect to the Internet:

1. If you are using a wired connection, please try to connect to Eduroam. Other floors should not be affected by the current works, so, if you are close to an access point on an adjacent floor, it may be possible to connect. 

2. If it is convenient to work on another floor, please try this, as connections should be working in these areas.

3. If you are using a personal device and have a mobile phone, you may wish to use tethering. This allows you to use the internet from your mobile phone on your computer. 

PLEASE NOTE THAT PERSONAL DATA CHARGES MAY APPLY. KCL ARE NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY DATA CHARGES THAT MAY BE INCURRED. 

Instructions on how to tether to your phone are available below. If you experience any difficulty connecting, please give the Service Desk a call on +44 (0)20 784 88888 and we will be happy to assist you.

How to set up Wi-Fi tether on iPhone 

To use Wi-Fi tethering (or Personal Hotspot, as it?s called) on the iPhone and iPad, follow these steps: 

? Go to Settings. 
? Tap Personal Hotspot. 
? Toggle Personal Hotspot On by tapping the button. 
? Using the device you want to connect with, scan for the Wi-Fi hotspot network, and enter the password when prompted. The password is automatically generated, but you can change it with a tap. There is no option to change the Wi-Fi network name as it?s linked to the name of your device. 

How to set up Wi-Fi tether on Android 

You can use your phone's mobile data to connect another phone, tablet or computer to the Internet. Sharing a connection this way is called tethering or using a hotspot. Some phones can share Wi-Fi connection by tethering. 

Important: Some mobile operators limit or charge extra for tethering. We recommend checking with your operator. 

Important: While it is easy to set up tethering, there is an added wrinkle for Android ? the user interface is not the same for every device. That means we can?t provide exact steps for every device. 

Some of these steps work only on Android 9 and up. 

Turn on your hotspot 1. Swipe down from the top of the screen. 
2. Tap Hotspot . 
? If you don?t find Hotspot , at the bottom left, tap Edit and drag Hotspot into your Quick Settings. 

---------------------------- OR -------------------------------------------------- 

? Go to Settings > Connections. 

? Tap Mobile Hotspot and Tethering. 

? Tap Mobile Hotspot. 

? Note the network name and password. 

? Toggle Mobile Hotspot On.

Choose how to tether Tether by Wi-Fi 

1. Swipe down from the top of the screen. 

2. Touch and hold Hotspot . 

3. Turn on Wi-Fi hotspot. Tip: To find or change your hotspot name or password, tap it. You may need to first tap Set up Wi-Fi hotspot. 

Connect another device to your phone's hotspot 

1. On the other device, open that device's list of Wi-Fi options. 

2. Pick your phone's hotspot name. 

3. Enter your phone's hotspot password. 

4. Click Connect. 

If you don't want your hotspot to require a password: 

1. Swipe down from the top of the screen. 

2. Touch and hold Hotspot . 

3. Under 'Security', tap None. Tip: You can share your phone's mobile data with up to 10 other devices via a Wi-Fi hotspot.

name: Outlook - Need password
content:
Please try the following troubleshooting :

Ensure Outlook is closed,
Open the registry editor and expand the following folders,

HKEY_CURRENT_USER > Software > Microsoft > Office > 16.0 > Common > Right click on Identity and select new DWORD (32Bit) Value, Rename this as 'EnableADAL'.
Once created please right click on EnableADAL - Modify and check the Value data is set to 0

Now can you again right click on Identity and select new DWORD (32Bit) Value, Rename this one as 'DisableADALatopWAMOverride'. 
Again can you right click - Modify and change the Value Data to 1.

Now open outlook again and you should see a pop up from windows security asking for a username and password (Knumber@kcl.ac.uk and IT password). Once the correct credentials are input the issue should be resolved.

name: Outlook Troubleshooting
content:
Does the issue happen in both OWA and the desktop application? 
If it happens in both, please provide the following details and escalate to collab :

- Is it a personal / shared / owned mailbox
- What troubleshooting steps have been taken
- Attach any relevant screenshots to the ticket
- Has there been a remote session?
- Are they using a personal or KCL SOE machine
- Service tag
- Contact number
- Location they would normally work on campus (campus / building / room number)

If the issue only occurs on the Outlook application and appears to be a client issue, please escalate to EUS with the same information above.


Outlook troubleshooting steps :

- Clear credential manager / new profile (Outlook disconnected)
- Outlook in offline mode (this has a template with instructions)
- Nav Pane reset (used when there are issues with the ribbon) (Close Outlook, Press Windows key + r, type outlook.exe /resetnavpane)
- Try in safe mode (in windows search type outlook.exe /safe)
- Office repair (try to use as a last resort as if Office repair fails, the suite will be removed and will need to be pushed out to device via AD using either of the following groups : 
SD-APP-Comp-Microsoft365AppsX64 AD group for 64-bit Office
SD-APP-Comp-Microsoft365AppsX32 AD group for 32-bit Office)

name: P2P - Foreign Payments Process
content:
Dear

This is to confirm that the Foreign Payment process will need to be completed for this invoice. The invoice and foreign payment form will need to be sent to foreignpayments@kcl.ac.uk to process. All foreign currency payments (and GBP payments to foreign bank accounts) need to follow this process.

Uploading Intrasta form or Foreign Payment form in Unit4 against your purchase orders does not get the invoice paid; that is for your reference only and will not be accessed by the team to process your invoice.

All foreign invoices need to be sent by the supplier to the end-users department that purchased the goods from them.

All payments going overseas or in a foreign currency require Foreign Payment Request VAT Declaration forms for us to proceed with payment.

If the invoice relates to goods which have been imported to the UK from another EU country the C1500 Intrastat form is also necessary.

Once the invoice is received, it needs to be goods receipted and then sent to the Foreign Payment team with the relevant paperwork as advised above.

We have only one foreign payment run per week each Wednesday.

For invoices to be included in the Wednesday payment run they need to be provided with all appropriate documentation before Monday 12 noon.

name: P2P - Requisition Closure
content:
Hello,

To close active requisitions, please follow the guidelines below:

Step 1: Go to Procurement >> Requisition >>Enquiries >> Own Requisition and click on the requisition number. 

Open the requisition you want to cancel/close. Once it has been opened tick all of the boxes on the left of the ?Requisition details? section and click the ?Close? button at the bottom of this section.

Step 2: Go to ?Requisition? section and choose ?Close? option from the dropdown.

Step 3: Click ?Save?  to save the changes.

name: P2P - Task Error 'No Punchout Line'
content:
Hello,

Please see the information below regarding your query:

Why am I getting the 'Catalogue Supplier no Punchout' error / task?

This happens when a Catalogue Supplier is chosen but either:
- your requisition contains product lines that have not been brought back from the catalogue, or
- changes have been made to the Product, Description, Quantity or Price.

If you need to buy something that is not on the catalogue, or where you have a special price, you must use the Off-Catalogue version of the supplier.

Free-format orders will need to be sent to the version that includes '(Off Catalogue only)' at the end of the name. Changing the supplier in both the 'Default supplier & Contract' section and the products lines in the 'Requisition details' section. This will fix the issue and allow the requisition to be submitted.

Quick hint: The supplier version linked to Science warehouse have ID's between 4000000 and 4000113.

name: Password has Expired (Resolution)
content:
Thank you for your contacting the IT Service Desk.

We have taken a look at your IT account, and can see that the password has expired. This is the reason why you are currently unable to login to your account or a specific service has stopped working for you.

We have recently introduced a new security policy requiring users to change their passwords once every 365 days. Throughout the summer, in a rolling programme we required all users to reset their network access password unless they had manually reset it within the last year.

Once reset you will receive a daily warning from 5 days before the next automatic reset is enforced.

To reset your password please go to https://passwordreset.kcl.ac.uk - your Username is your knumber@kcl.ac.uk 

The requirements for your password are a minimum of 12 characters and it must contain 3 of the following:

Lower case letter
Upper case letter,
Number.

You must also not use your name, common words or symbols in your password. It also cannot be the same as your previous password.

If you are having trouble using this system, please reply to this email with a screenshot attached of the issue you are having and we will do our best to assist.

Kind Regards,
IT Service Desk

name: Phishing Advice - Resolution
content:
Hi,

Thank you for reporting this issue to us. 

We can confirm that the email you have received is a phishing scam, designed to look as if it comes from a legitimate source, such as a KCL account or bank. The aim is to trick you into revealing personal information such as your password, or to infect your device with malware. 

If you have clicked the link in the email then please ring the Service Desk as soon as possible so we can advise on any remedial action. If you have not clicked the link, please simply delete the email.

If you are worried about your account security, you can reset your password via the following link: https://passwordreset.kcl.ac.uk/default.aspx

For more information about phishing and staying safe online, please see the following links;

https://internal.kcl.ac.uk/it/security/Advice-and-Support/phishing.aspx
https://self-service.kcl.ac.uk/article/KA-01353/en-us
https://self-service.kcl.ac.uk/article/KA-01291/en-us

name: Phishing Email Received
content:
.eml / .msg file (essential) - Please ask user to save email as a file (Outlook > File > Save as) and attach it back in a reply to us.

Does it appear to be phishing or spam?

Confirm with user if they have clicked any contents such as hyper links or attached files. If they have, please create a new ticket and run through normal malware procedure (trend scan, password change and ticket to Cyber Security)

Ticket can then be passed to collab for further investigation.

name: Power BI - Pro license
content:
Thank you for submitting your request and contacting the Service Desk.

All users can download Power BI Desktop from the IT Software Centre and begin developing straight away. Once developers have content they want to share, they will need to apply for developer permissions, which is essentially a Pro Licence. In order to create Workspaces and add to the Premium capacity, access needs to be granted. Developers will need to read various policy documents and abide to them. Adherence to these will be monitored and individuals who don?t follow them will have their developer permissions revoked.

If you require developer permissions, we require the submission of a self-service form. This is available at 8888.kcl.ac.uk under RemedyForce Self-Service form 'Request Power BI Developer Permissions'.

name: Power BI - View Report
content:
Thank you for submitting your request and contacting the Service Desk.

Power BI premium Licenses are assigned to all staff and affiliates, the license allows you to do the following:

-       View reports, a catalogue of some of the available reports is available in the following link: https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/apps/f54c74a9-d007-42bd-912f-aaf30a1ba19e/reports/91a2bc4f-7db9-408c-b4e0-86f905448e35/ReportSection532b85f61e8939903c85?ctid=8370cf14-16f3-4c16-b83c-724071654356

name: Ransomware
content:
In the event of a suspected ransomware incident please find out and note the below:

Section 1:

How was Threat Identified?
What is occurring currently?
Any other relevant information

If section 1 indicates that this is a phishing attempt, please follow Phishing process.

If you suspect this is a Ransomware attack, please consult a Team Lead or Senior whilst the user is on the phone and gather the following information:

Contact Phone Number
Device Name
Location (if on site)
Department
Any possible risk for GDPR

 If this is a ransomware attack, the team lead or senior will escalate as needed and log a fresh P1.

 Do not accept e-mails from the machine and definately don't try to Remotely access. If theuser can take a photo of any error messages/ issues and send from an unaffected device then please get them to do so.

User should then disconnect from the network and switch the machine off.

name: Remote Desktop Connection / Protocol setup - Service Desk
content:
Setting up Remote Desktop Connection / Protocol is now a process actioned by the Service Desk.

This can only be setup for customers when they are using an SOE device and need to remote into another SOE device. This can't be setup for personal devices to connect to SOE and VPN will not be granted for this.

https://emckclac.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/ESMdsd/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B0B11ACBD-3D50-4399-941B-58B6DE0763C0%7D&file=RDP.docx&action=default&mobileredirect=true

The above Word document will take you through the steps of setting this up on the DESTINATION device.

You will be able to use the remote desktop connection app built into windows to connect to any SOE using your W account. 

Please follow the steps once remoted in to add the customers K number to the allowed users list and disconnect. The customer can then RDP in to the machine.

If you are unable to connect to the machine, the device will likely be turned off or has no network connection.

As admins you can log any current users off however PLESAE CHECK THE PERSON HAS SAVED BEFOREHAND.

name: Remote Exam Support
content:
There are three stages of support that we can give a student who is experiencing technical difficulties:

1.  Normal troubleshooting
Analysts should ask the usual questions, for instance: web browsers (which browser is being used, cookies, cache etc.), usernames & passwords, ask for screenshots etc. If a student is reporting that their exam is not appearing within KEATS, this is likely to be a time zone issue. Students will be allowed 24 hours to complete their exam; all times are GMT/ GMT+1 (Local time in the UK). Please be sure to ask the students which country they are contacting us from and be sure to remind them to take the time difference into account.
 
2. FAQs
In the event that troubleshooting does not resolve the issue, please refer students to the FAQs link that will be in the Remedyforce ticket template resolution. 
 
3. Direct to TEL Officer
If troubleshooting has not worked, please refer the student to the FAQs. However, you will need to advise the student to contact their TEL Officer if the answer/ information they need is not covered in the FAQs. It is at this point that the ITSD cannot offer any more help or advise for students experiencing difficulties with their remote exams.

name: Resi - 2020 selecting arrival
content:
Thank you for contracting King's Residences.

Please log into your accommodation portal and head to the 'Your Arrival' section. Here you can confirm your contract start date, confirm if you are self isolating with us and also add or remove the early arrival week if necessary.

You can access your portal here:

https://accommodation.kcl.ac.uk

The deadline to complete the 'your arrival' section in your portal has been extended for one more day, please ensure you go and submit by selecting the 'your arrival' tab as soon as possible. If we do not receive this information from you, you will be charged from the main arrival weekend of September 19th. 

Please note, if you select the main arrival date, you do not get an email to confirm, you will get a message on your portal after clicking submit advising it has been successful.

Following your confirmation of contract start date, you will be emailed shortly asking you to complete a health and safety induction and book your specific arrival date/time.

Our COVID19 FAQ has been recently updated, please see here for all the information you need regarding arriving and isolating with us along with out safety measures:

https://www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation/residences-covid-19-updates

Kind regards, 

The Residences Team
Estates & Facilities Directorate
King?s College London
0207 848 5959
kingsresidences@kcl.ac.uk

name: Resi - 2020/2021 Applications
content:
Dear 

Applications for the 2020/2021 academic year will open in March (exact date TBC). We are currently updating the application portal to enhance to application experience.
As soon as the portal is ready to accept applications, we will announce it on our website and social media pages.

Applications received before the end of May 2020 (deadline date tbc) will be guaranteed accommodation, applications made after the deadline date will be allocated a room from remaining availability, on a first come first served basis. 

It can take up to 6 weeks to receive your housing offer during peak application times, but should take much less than this for the majority of applicants, so please keep an eye on your email and application portal to avoid missing an offer when it comes.

If you have any questions about our residences, please do not hesitate to contact us again.

Good luck with your application and upcoming studies at King's.

content:

As you did not register in time to meet the guaranteed housing deadline, unfortunately we are unable to guarantee accommodation for you.

Please keep checking your portal for availability over the coming weeks as rooms may become bookable due to student cancellations and also around clearing when rooms for those who did not meet course conditions will be re-released. If you wish to look further afield, there is a wide range of accommodation options in London - from traditional students house shares to lodging with a live in landlord, as well as an increasing range of private residences, which house students from across several London universities.  The best place to start is by visiting the University of London webpages where they have a comprehensive guide to renting in the private sector student housing listing and links to approved landlords, letting agents and private halls of residences. you can find it here: https://housing.london.ac.uk/

name: Resi - Belongings collection 2021
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

We hope you are staying safe and wish you well.

If you have cancelled your accommodation but still have belongings in your room, they are safe and secure, however, we do need you to begin arranging collection of your things either yourself or by hiring a 3rd Party company to pack and store or pack and ship your things back to you. We are not able to offer onsite storage for your belongings.

Whilst we are confident you will be able to locate suitable companies, to assist you, we have listed below a few companies that other students have recently used to provide a packing and removal service for them. If you contact any of these companies, please ensure they meet your needs fully before booking with them. 

Love Space E: info@lovespace.co.uk / T: +44 800 802 1018 

Baggage Hub ? E: info@baggagehub.com / T: +44 333 050 7530 

Storage Boys E: sales@storageboys.co.uk / T: +44 7863 115 858 / T: +44 7751 300 045 

Ping Locker E: support@pinglocker.com / T: +44 203 368 8454 

ABS Removals E: info@absremovals.com / T: +44 208 341 3007 

Removal Experts - E: info@removalexperts.co.uk / T: +44 208 3517 101 

*Please note that we are not liable for any bookings made with a third party company and we urge you to fully research your options before booking a service.

The UK Government have set out a step by step road map for the release of current restrictions. The 17th May is the date we have considered as the end of the 'lockdown' as this is when free travel and restrictions on gathering are no longer required. You will therefore have a maximum of 4 weeks from this date to arrange the collection of your belongings. Please start your arrangements now and collect as soon as you are able, please do not leave it until the last minute to avoid any unwanted charges or disposal of items left behind.

Kind Regards

The Residences Team

name: Resi - Belongings HILTON
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

We appreciate your patience during this very unique situation and hope that you are well and keeping safe.

Please check your email inbox and junk folders for further communications that have been sent to you regarding the collection/packing/storage of any belongings that you have left behind. There are a number of options to help you.

You can arrange for someone to collect your belongings on your behalf, for example a friend or a relative.  Alternatively, you can arrange for a removal/storage company to pack and ship them to your home address or arrange for them to place your belongings in their storage facility. Please note that this would need to be booked and paid for by you with a company direct. 

Whether you are collecting personally, or you have nominated others to collect on your behalf, to help us ensure safe distancing within residences, you will need to book a collection slot. Slots are available between 8am and 5pm up until 30 June 2020, to book your slot please log into your accommodation portal and select one. Please make sure to indicate your name, room number at Hilton when reserving your collection slot. 

Please ensure that you are contacting Helena Carter once you have booked your slot so that she can assist you with the collection of any belongings stored in Champion Hill. Her email address is helena.1.carter@kcl.ac.uk.

We hope you will have sufficient time to collect your belongings, however we do understand that there may be instances where this may prove challenging so do please contact us at kingsresidences@kcl.ac.uk  if this is the case, as we are able to arrange for King?s staff to pack on your behalf and store until you return to campus, or discuss any alternative arrangements.?  

Overnight stays cannot be accommodated for during this process.

Kind Regards

The Residences Team

name: Resi - Cancellation enquiry
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences

Depending on where you are in the bookings process, cancellation terms will vary:
 
1) If you have booked a room and want to cancel after the 10th June (2022) deadline, you will loose your £450.00 pre-payment. You can cancel in your portal using the 'cancel' button.

2) If you have booked a room and want to cancel after the 10th June deadline and the contract start date has passed (but you have not moved in), you will loose your £450.00 pre-payment and be charged an additional 4 weeks rent. You can cancel in your portal using the 'cancel' button.

3) If you are wanting to cancel after moving in, you can no longer pay to cancel and must find another full time KCL student, not already in a contract, to transfer the contract to. Please see our website for more information: https://www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation/living-with-us/contract-change 

* If you have withdrawn from your course or deferred your place until the following year, you can request a cancellation via your accommodation portal. We will refund the £450.00 in these circumstances. If you have already checked into your accommodation the rent pre-payment will not be refunded and you will be liable for the fee until the next Saturday of your check out date or withdrawal confirmation date (whichever comes last). You are only allowed to stay for a maximum of 2 weeks from the date of the withdrawal confirmation

Please see our full cancellation matrix online here: https://www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation/assets/policies/cancellation-policy-22-23.pdf

Please don't hesitate to contact us back should you have any further queries.

Kind Regards

King's Residences
Estates and Facilities Directorate
King's College London  
Tel: +44 (0)20 7848 5959
Email: kingsresidences@kcl.ac.uk

World class services for a world class university  

Please see our updated FAQ for any information about COVID19 and self-isolation in the residences:
https://www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation/covid-19-updates

name: Resi - Cant Log in
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

You can access our online accommodation portal here: https://accommodation.kcl.ac.uk

If this is the first time you have tried to log into the portal, please put your student number in the username box (also known as your KCL ID) and click on the 'forgot password' button. A temporary password will be sent to the email address you have registered with admissions, then you will be prompted to create a new password. You will then be able to log into the accommodation portal. 

If you are having difficulty logging into the portal, we recommend that you use either Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox. Please also ensure you are using a laptop or desktop to ensure the best possible performance of the portal, as it may not work as effectively on a mobile or tablet device.

We look forward to welcoming you for the next academic year.

Please don?t hesitate to get back to us should you have any additional queries.

Kind Regards
The Residences Team

name: Resi - Cant see room [DO NOT REOPEN]
content:
Thank you for contacting Kings Residences.

If the room type or residence you would prefer to book is not showing on the portal, this could be due to:

1) You are filtering your searches by criteria such as price, location or room type, this will limited your choice of options available.

Or

2) Your choice of residence may simply not be available. Unfortunately space is very limited now and many residences are fully booked.

If you cannot book your preferred choice of residence, we would encourage you to consider alternative locations across the Residences portfolio, from the remaining available places. We have no further rooms to release now and the places you see are all we have.

If you have any further questions or if you need any assistance, please do not hesitate to contact us again.

Kind regards,

The Residences Team

name: Resi - Cant Update Application
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

We are sorry that you have been unable to update your application. After looking at your profile, we can see that your housing offer is imminent, therefore your portal is locked to prevent any changes whilst the system sends out your offer.

If you are unhappy with the offer that you receive, you are welcome to decline it then log in and update your preferences from the following Monday afternoon. Please note that if you decline your offer you are not guaranteed another one, if you decline two offers, your application will be cancelled and no further offers will be made to you.

If you are trying to log in and apply for KAAS, unfortunately you will not be able to via your portal at this time, you can however submit a 'request for reconsideration' form from the website instead, this will be treated the same as an application made via the portal.

You can find the form here: 
https://www.kcl.ac.uk/study/accommodation/residences/rents-affordability.aspx

Please do let us know if you need any further assistance

Kind regards

The Residences Team

The KAAS Panel will evaluate your application based on the information you have provided.

When you invitation to book is sent to you, it will specify if you have been given KAAS or not. If you have been rejected and you feel it was due to the information you were unable to add to your application, you are welcome to appeal the decision using the form at the bottom of the KAAS page online:

name: Resi - Covid Cancellations
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences,

As the University has confirmed this week that they will be continuing with their blended approach to teaching, students are able to continue with their studies as normal on campus or choose to be online only.

This means that the recent message regarding cancellations has changed. We are aware many students were advised that they can cancel as long as the room is clear and the keys are handed in. this is no longer the case and students wishing to cancel their contracts must find another full time KCL student to take over the room as per the license agreement. This is because in the majority of cases, it is the students choice to stay on campus or go home and not something the University has arranged for you.

If you are confirmed to be studying online only for the remainder of the year, please do let us know by sending an email to kingsresidences@kcl.ac.uk with a confirmation from your faculty attached. We will then forward this to the Allocations team for their consideration.

Please do not hesitate to contact us again should you need any further assistance,

name: Resi - COVID report self-isolation
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences and letting us know about your need to self isolate. 

If you have not already done so, please immediately fill in the University self-isolation reporting form so that we can arrange the necessary support for you:

https://www.kcl.ac.uk/coronavirus/form

If you need to quarantine or self-isolate it means that you must stay in your room and only interact with others online or by phone, even those in your flat (household).

We know this will be hard but it is really important to protect the other people you are living with and those in the community.

- You need to stay in your room for the quarantine/self-isolation period.
- You cannot go to the shops or go outside, even for exercise.
- You will need to order food and groceries online which the residences team will bring to your door.
- You are able to use the kitchen during this period but you must be alone in the kitchen, wear a face covering, sanitise the work areas before and after use, do not share utensils, cutlery or crockery, and take food back to your room to eat.
- The residences team will check in with you regularly either online or by phone.

You will still be able to take part in online teaching, activities and access our services whilst you are quarantining/self-isolating.

All students in a King's residence who need to quarantine will be provided with the appropriate support such as assistance with food provision and deliveries brought to flats.

Please do reach out to your welfare leads for support if you need them, you can find all of their contact details online here:

https://www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation/living-with-us/welfare

If there is anything more you need, please do let us know.

Warm Regards

The Residences Team

name: Resi - COVID19 Termination [DO NOT REOPEN]
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

We appreciate your patience during this very unique situation and hope that you are well and staying safe.

We understand that many students are looking to return home to be with their families and we are doing our utmost to support you at this time. If you would like to cancel your contract to go home, please send a new email to kingsresidences@kcl.ac.uk answering the following: 

Your full name:
Student ID:
Your residence:
Your room number: 

Have you already submitted a smart survey?: Y/N
Have you moved out already?: 
If yes, what date did you move out?: 
Have you cleared your room?: 
If no, what date are you planning to move out: 
Have you left belongings in your room?
Will you be back again this academic year?: 
If yes, what date are you planning on returning): 

**Please note that your contract will be cancelled on a Saturday as per your license agreement, If for example, you are departing on Wednesday 27th May, you will be charged until Saturday 30th May**

If you have left belongings behind please ensure you have provided us with the details above, your belongings will be kept safe and not removed from your room. Unfortunately, due to the government guidelines on social distancing, we cannot allow anyone who is not living in your residence, to access your room to pack your things. We are currently working on ways we can support you to coordinate the packing and removal of any remaining belongings, and will update you with options at a later date. 

Please see the link below for the updated insurance policy regarding your belongings and contents:

https://www.endsleigh.co.uk/faqs/question/coronavirus-update-block-possessions-insurance/

If you have not yet departed, please plan carefully and clear your room as much as physically possible when you go, this will help to prevent any issues in the future with collecting your belongings.

If you have already paid for term three onward, you can request a refund of overpaid fees via your MyKCL portal once your cancellation has been confirmed. A refund will not automatically be generated if you are cancelling.

Further information regarding moving out, returning to residences, leaving your belongings and COVID19 can be found on our website: https://www.kcl.ac.uk/coronavirus/students/money-housing

Kind Regards

The Residences Team

PLEASE DO NOT REPLY TO THIS EMAIL AS WE ARE UNABLE TO PROCESS RESPONSES.

Most of our students will have paid their college fees for 2020/21 but we are aware that some of you may have other arrangements in place, in line with your funding.  If your income has reduced or you are worried about your financial security during the COVID-19 outbreak, and feel that you are unable to keep up with your financial commitments to the university, you can request more time to pay by contacting Credit Control about your situation. name: Resi - Early termination request
content:
Thank you for sending in your request for an early termination of your Residences license agreement. We appreciate you have shared your personal circumstances with us and want to reassure you this will be handled with absolute sensitivity and confidence.

As per the Early Termination Request Process, we do need both a fully completed Early Termination Form and supporting evidence for your request to be considered. From your email, we can see we are currently missing [insert what is missing e.g. personal statement, evidence etc]. Due to this being incomplete, we will be rejecting your application at this time and closing your ticket. We encourage you to review the guidance online regarding early release from contract using the link below and resubmit your request once you have fulfilled the necessary criteria. You can do this by replying to this email. This will reopen your ticket and your request can be reviewed again.

https://www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation/living-with-us/contract-change

If you are concerned about your wellbeing during this time, we encourage you to contact your Residence Welfare Lead team for further support. Their contact information can be found here. 

https://www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation/living-with-us/welfare

Please also note the wider support services available at King?s, list below:

?	King?s College NHS Health Centre Tel: 0207 848 2613 Web: kclnhshealthcentre.com  
?	Student Services* Tel: 020 7123 4843 Web: self-service.kcl.ac.uk 
*Student Services provide access to the Disability Support Service, the Counselling & Mental Health Service, Fees, Funding and Money Advice, International Student Support and Housing & Accommodation Support as well as other services. Support Services at King?s remain accessible to students but please not that, due to COVID-19, many of these services may have moved to remote access. Please contact the Service directly for further information. In case of emergency or if you are in crisis: kcl.ac.uk/counselling/crisis-support  
?	Togetherall: If you find yourself in need of support, we recommend Togetherall which is a safe and anonymous online space you can go to if you?re feeling down, struggling to cope or just want to talk to people who understand what you?re going through. The service is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week from any device with an internet connection. King?s College London provides funding for every student to have full access to TogetherAll for 6 months. All you need to do is sign up with your KCL email to access this support.
?	KCLSU can be contacted for additional support and guidance; advisors can be contacted via an online form at kclsu.org/advice form/ and for urgent queries on 020 7848 4588.? 

I hope this information is helpful.
Warm regards,
King?s Residences

name: Resi - Error in Application
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

After checking your application, there appears to be some missing information or an error with your choices, This is why you have not yet been made an offer.

Please log into your portal and update your application, ensuring all of the following questions have been answered:

1. How many academic years would you like us to offer you accommodation for?
2. How many weeks would you like your 18/19 contract for?
3. Would you like to move in a week earlier than the start of your contract in order to settle in before the big move-in weekend?
4. Our residences are of mix gender, however, would you like to live in a gender specific flat?


Once you have checked these questions, please make sure that the locations you have chosen are available for the length of contract you need (eg: if you have selected a 51 week contract then chosen Stamford Street Apartments, you will not receive an offer)

After your application has been amended, it can take up to 6 weeks to receive your offer. If you have previously applied before the guaranteed housing deadline and not had an offer, you will still be guaranteed

Please do not hesitate to contact us if you require any further assistance.

name: Resi - Invoices
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

If you have amended your contract start date to October 31st or January 9th, you will be asked to make a 4-week upfront pre-payment to hold the room for you.

An email will be sent to you by the end of next week with further details and instructions on how to pay. Please keep an eye on your inbox and junk folders. Payments must be made within 14 days of receiving the email. 

If you are arriving from 31st October you will be sent an invoice after move-in covering the period of your stay, and any pre-payment that you have made will be deducted from this sum. Again, this invoice will be payable within 14 days from the date of the email being received.

If you are arriving from 09th January you will pay your first installment as normal on the 25th January.

For further information about your accommodation payments, including how to pay and your installment dates, please see section 10 of your contract.

If you are booked with Orchard Lisle & Iris Brook or the Intercollegiate Halls, please contact them directly regarding your contract and billing arrangements.

Please see our updated FAQ for any information about COVID19 and self-isolation in the residences:
https://www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation/covid-19-updates

Kind Regards,

The Residences Team

name: Resi - KAAS Application Form Error
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences. 

We are sorry to hear that you are having problems with your KAAS application.

The most common reason for the error message you are getting is due to your personal statement being too long. The personal statement box can contain 2000 characters in total, this includes full words, spaces and punctuation marks.

Please check the length of your statement, condense it and try again. If your statement is below the 2000 character limit and you can still not apply, please do let us know and we can investigate this further for you. 

We apologise for any inconvenience caused. 

Kind Regards, 

The Residences Team

name: Resi - Returning To Residences COVID19 [DO NOT REOPEN]
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

Many students have decided to cancel their accommodation contracts for this academic year due to the coronavirus situation. In the current climate, following Government advice and travel restrictions we are not allowing students to return to residences.

If you have left belongings behind, your things will continue to be kept safe and not removed from your room for the time being. We are working on booking slot process for those who wish to return to collect their belongings and we will keep you updated with new information as we have it. Please note that students will not be allowed to move back as part of the process.

Please see the link below for the updated insurance policy regarding your belongings and contents:
https://www.endsleigh.co.uk/faqs/question/coronavirus-update-block-possessions-insurance/

If you have not yet departed, please plan carefully and clear your room when you go, this will help to prevent any issues in the future with collecting your belongings.

If you have already paid your fees for accommodation, but decided to cancel, you can request a refund of overpaid fees via your MyKCL portal once your cancellation has been confirmed by the Allocations team (please do not request the refund before you have been confirmed). A refund will not automatically be generated if you are cancelling.

Further FAQs regarding COVID19 can be found on the website: https://www.kcl.ac.uk/coronavirus/students/money-housing

Kind Regards

The Residences Team

name: Resi - Self Serve Cancellation [DO NOT REOPEN]
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences and we are sorry to hear that you wish to cancel.

Depending on where you are in the bookings process, cancellation terms will vary:

1) If you have booked a room and cancel within the 14 days cooling off period, cancellation is free of charge and can be done in your portal using the 'cancel' button
 
2) If you have booked a room and cancel before the cancellation deadline of 31st May (2020), cancellation is free of charge and can be done in the portal using the 'cancel' button
 
3) If you have booked a room and want to cancel after the 31st May deadline and outside of the 14 days cooling off period, cancellation is £500. You can cancel in your portal using the 'cancel' button.

4) If you have booked a room and want to cancel after the 31st May deadline, you have passed 
 your 14 days cooling off period and the contract start date has gone (but you have not moved in) cancellation is charged at £500 plus 4 weeks rent. You can cancel in your portal using the 'cancel' button.

5) If you are wanting to cancel after moving in, you can no longer pay to cancel and must find another full time KCL student, not already in a contract, to transfer the contract to. Please see our website for more information: https://www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation/living-with-us/contract-change 

6) If you are withdrawing or deferring (regardless of whether you have moved in or not) the contract will be voided at no cost to you

We hope this helps you.

*Our FAQs regarding COVID, isolation and arrival have been updated, please see our website for some helpful information:
https://www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation/covid-19-updates

Kind Regards

The Residences Team
King's Residences
Estates and Facilities Directorate
King's College London  
Tel: +44 (0)20 7848 5959
Email: kingsresidences@kcl.ac.uk

World class services for a world class university

You will be sent a temporary password to log in to the email address associated with your student record. Please input the temporary password and click 'login'. A popup will tell you that you need to change your password, please click to continue and reset to a password of your choice.

name: Resi - Student Not Found on Mercury
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

Unfortunately, we have been unable to locate your details in our accommodation system. This is usually because you are a part time student, or have accepted your academic offer less than 2 working days ago, or that King's is not your first, firm choice university. 

If we are your insurance university choice, unfortunately you will not be able to apply for housing at this time. 

If we are your first choice, please ensure that you have waited the full 2 working days then try again to log in. If you still cannot log in after this time, do give us a call on 020 7848 5959 and we will be able to look into it further for you.

If you are a part time student, unfortunately you are not eligible for King's Residences accommodation, however, you can contact the advice and guidance team who are able to offer advice on private housing.

If you wish to speak to the Advice & Guidance Team by phone, you can call the Student Advice Line on + 44 (0)20 7848 7001 as follows:

Tuesday and Thursday between 1-3pm
Friday between 9-11am

Email: advice@kcl.ac.uk


Should you require any further accommodation related assistance in the future, you can email us on kingsresidences@kcl.ac.uk or give us a call and we will be happy to help you.

Good luck for your upcoming academic year and we look forward to welcoming you to King's.

Kind regards

The Residences Team
Estates & Facilities Directorate
King?s College London
0207 848 5959
kingsresidences@kcl.ac.uk

name: Resi - Student of Concern
content:
Helpful script: 

We appreciate that you are very worried at this time and I want to reassure you that King?s takes the welfare of it?s students very seriously.

We do have to explain though that we are unable to disclose any personal data about a student without their expressed written consent. We take confidentiality and data protection extremely seriously and we must be careful what information we release. We realise this isn?t helpful but please do continue trying to reach them in the meantime. If you feel it is an emergency, please contact the emergency services on 999.

In this instance, we will forward your message to our Welfare Team, who will make contact with the student and request that they contact yourselves.

name: Resi - Waitlist 2021/22
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences. 

If you are a first year undergraduate OR a new international postgraduate student for the 21/22 academic year, you are still guaranteed accommodation if you have registered before 10th June and have placed yourself on the accommodation waitlist.

Whilst on the waitlist, you are still able to use your portal to check availability and book a room if one becomes available for you due to other student cancellations. If you have been unsuccessful in booking a room by August 2nd 2021, you will be contacted again from 09th August 2021 by email, and given priority access to the accommodation portal following A level results day, to book a room from newly available places.

Whilst we can guarantee a room will be available for you to book in the accommodation portal somewhere across the residences portfolio, we cannot guarantee that it will be within your preferences for location or room type. 

If you choose not to book from available rooms now or on the priority booking day, you will not longer be guaranteed and given access again from 17th August to make a booking from the remaining availability on a first come first served basis.

If you are not covered by the accommodation guarantee, you can also add yourself to a waitlist, however, we cannot guarantee that a room will be available for you. Once the guaranteed students have used their priority access to book, you will be given access to check availability and select accommodation on a first come first served basis from the remaining available places. Please also continue to check your portal for new room availability and updates.

Kind Regards, 

The Residences Team
King's Residences
Estates and Facilities Directorate
King's College London  
Tel: +44 (0)20 7848 5959
Email: kingsresidences@kcl.ac.uk

We do have to explain though that we are unable to disclose any personal data about a student without their expressed written consent. We take confidentiality and data protection extremely seriously and we must be careful what information we release. We realise this isn?t helpful but please do continue trying to reach them in the meantime. if you feel it is an emergency, please contact the emergency services on 999?.

However in this instance, we will forward this message to our Welfare Manager Nicky, who will get in contact with you as soon as possible to discuss this with you personally.

We hope this helps you and rest assured, you will be contacted very shortly.

Warm regards,

The Residences Team

name: Resi - Withdrawal sent in error
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

We have received a withdrawal request from you, but you are not listed as withdrawn in your student record. This request will be disregarded and no further action taken.

If you were trying to reduce your contract length, unfortunately this is not possible, our contracts have set lengths and are non negotiable. Depending on how much time is left on your contract, you could transfer the remaining time to another student, please follow this link for more information on contract transfers:
https://www.kcl.ac.uk/study/accommodation/moving-in/contract-change

If you have very recently applied to withdraw, it may not be showing up on your student record yet, in this instance, please reply to this email with a copy of your confirmation of withdrawal when you receive it. Please note for all students who are also on an AKC, you will need to withdraw from this too and provide your confirmation as above.

Kind regards

The Residences Team

name: Resi ? Clearing 2021 [DO NOT REOPEN]
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

We hope you are keeping safe. 

Please note the Accommodation Portal is currently closed for confirmation and clearing. During this period, while we can assist with general enquiries, we are unfortunately not able respond to specific questions related to your contract or academic status. 

If you hold an accommodation offer, you will be asked to confirm your arrival date soon, please keep an eye on your emails.

If you are on our waitlist, guaranteed students will be contacted from the 10th August regarding making a booking and all non-guaranteed students will be contacted shortly after. 

If you have received an academic offer and accepted through the clearing process, we will ask you to register your interest in accommodation when the portal re-opens. You will be granted access to the portal to view availability shortly after.

For more information about arriving in Residences or measures we have put in place to unsure your stay with us remains and safe and enjoyable, please visit our Moving-in page and COVID19 page.

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Kind Regards, 
The Residences Team

Data kept on your King's account OneNote, OneDrive for Business, Teams, SharePoint or other university systems is the property of King's College London and not the individual.

Copying, exporting or storing data before your account expires constitutes an information security risk, and as such breaches GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation) and KCL Data Policy.

For more information, please visit https://www.kcl.ac.uk/governancezone/governancelegal/data-protection-policy

name: Sanger Mouse Management System (MMS) Issue
content:
1. Is this a hardware issue with the laptop or printer?
If Yes, resolve the issue if able or assign to End User Services - DO NOT advise customer to visit a TechBar.
If No, continue troubleshooting.

2. Is this a different hardware issue (not laptop or printer) e.g. scanner, keyboard, mouse or trolley?
If Yes, please refer them onto their Business Administrator (mmsadmin@kcl.ac.uk)
If No, continue troubleshooting.
 
3. System issue. Is customer able to log into the system?
If Yes, please refer them onto their Business Administrator in the first instance (mmsadmin@kcl.ac.uk)
If No, continue troubleshooting.

4. Is the login issue affecting multiple users?
If Yes, assign to Education Applications.
If No, continue troubleshooting.

5. Has user been able to access the system before?
If No, refer them to their Business Administrator (mmsadmin@kcl.ac.uk) for their access request to be processed.
If Yes, continue troubleshooting.
 
6. Error message user is receiving (include screen shot)

7. Details of 1st Line Troubleshooting undertaken, e.g. reboot device, try on another machine

8. If the issue is outside of the Service Desk?s remit to resolve, copy all information into an email to the Business Administrator (mmsadmin@kcl.ac.uk)

name: Shared Drive P2 Duplicate
content:
Hello,

Thank you for your email.

Could you kindly restart your device and confirm if this resolves the issue?

Could you also provide screenshots of the error message received and your list of WiFi networks, specifically the 'KCL Windows Remote Access'?
 
To help us deliver an efficient service, please respond to this email within 5 working days. If you cannot provide the necessary information in this time, it is important you tell us, otherwise we will close your ticket.

Kind regards,

name: Shared Drives
content:
PLEASE NOTE - SHARED DRIVE ACCESS (J: & R:) CAN BE GRANTED BY THE SERVICE DESK USING AD, AS LONG AS REQUEST HAS BEEN MADE BY AN OWNER.

Troubleshooting steps to complete-

	
Check customer has permission to access the folder. (If you have any issues with checking this instant message someone from the 2nd line team)

Can colleagues view the folder? (If they can this is not a shared drive issue, it is likely to be an issue with the machine, or their network connection)

Remote onto the device ask the user to demonstrate the issue and try the 'working offline work around' (in file explorer - easy access - work offline - work online).

Check the Direct access is connected.

------
 
If they are on an SOE machine and they are connecting via DA and you have checked with C&S that the storage is up and working it needs to go to EUS.

To escalate to EUS, ensure you have the computer name, a contact number and the file path.

name: Shared Drives on Personal Device (resolution)
content: Unfortunately the only way to access King's resources from outside our network is on a King's SOE device. name: Shared Mailbox Not Updating - Disable Cached Exchange Mode
content:
Hello,

Thank you for contacting Service Desk.

We believe disabling Cached Exchange Mode will resolve your issue. To do this, please follow the guidance below.

In the Outlook Desktop application, Click File > Account Settings > Account Settings.
In the Account Settings, highlight your email address and click on the 'Change' button above it.
Under Offline Settings, uncheck Use Cached Exchange Mode.
Exit, and then restart Outlook.

Kind Regards,

IT Service Desk

name: SIM - SSF Missing Serv. Provider
content:
Hi <client>.

Thanks for flagging this - this happens when a self-service form has not been set with a 'Service Provider'. Service Providers tell the form which 'livery' (Header and Footer) to use when sending the Ticket Created notifications and, in the absence of one, Remedyforce will apply the Service Provider attached to the user who logged the ticket (in this case <user> and the <Serv.Provider> Service Provider).

This is purely aesthetic, it does not impact how the ticket is handled. I have added the correct Service Provider onto the self-service form now, and also amended the ticket so that all future ticket notifications will be on the correct livery.

Best wishes

S x

name: SITS Performance Issue PR1855
content:
**Important information to gather**

SITS Questions to be asked on first contact
How are you connecting to SITS? (DirectAccess/VPN/Remoting on to a PC on-site)

How do you launch SITS?	

Could you please state what screens you were trying to access, or processes you were trying to run?
	 
Does SITS freeze / crash completely, or is it slower than you would normally expect if you were working on site?
	 
How long were you able to use SITS for before it froze / crashed, and are these freezes / crashes one off occurrences or do they happen multiple times a day?
	 
In the event of getting error messages, could you please provide us with a screen shot of the error message, and also send us details of any errors that you are getting in the message buffer 	 


General Network Queries to be followed up via email, as these may take some time for the user to complete
Who is your broadband provider?	 

Are you connecting via wifi or wired connection?
 
Please use Google's Speed Test to test your network connection speed 
Download	 
	Upload	 
	Latency/Ping	 

How many other devices are using your network at any one time?	 

Were these issues happening on-site before working from home?
	 
Do these issues happen at any particular time of day?

name: Skype for business log in (after MFA update)
content:
Thank you for contacting the IT Service Desk.

To resolve this issue,

1. Set the sign-in address on the first Skype screen to your email address.

2. When you get the Microsoft pop-up which asks for your password, don't enter your password. Instead, click 'sign in with a different account' 

3. Enter your k-number@kcl.ac.uk and now please enter  your password.

Please see the following MFA guide for further information (information in regards to office programs can be found on page 10) - https://www.kcl.ac.uk/it/assets/using-mfa.pdf

If you have done this and continue to experience issues, please get back to us, providing a screen shot if possible, and we will reopen the ticket.

name: Skype for Business Off Campus Workaround for Mac
content: This issue is a known error on Microsoft's side. To work around this please install Forticlient for the user. This will allow you to log into SfB on Mac off campus. Once you have logged in to SfB it should cache the credentials so Forticlient will not be required for it to run in future instances.

name: SPA - Accessing Power BI apps
content:
Hi <insert user name>

Thanks for your email. To access Power BI apps:

1. Login in to Power BI web service <insert URL: https://app.powerbi.com/home> using your King's credentials.
Once you've logged on, you can view apps/ reports 'Shared with me' from the left hand side menu.

2. Click on the 'Apps'  on the left hand menu
3. Click the yellow 'Get Apps' button to the top right
4. Navigate to the Organisational tab to get apps built by other users within the organisation.
(Some apps are restricted, in which case you will need to contact the developers of that app).
5 Scroll to search through the available apps or use keywords in the search bar.
6. Click on'Get it now'
7. Navigate back to the Apps page to access the app.

For a list of apps supported by the Analytics team, check out the Report Catalogue <insert URL: https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/91a2bc4f-7db9-408c-b4e0-86f905448e35/ReportSection532b85f61e8939903c85>. This also gives information about the app and the access restrictions that apply.

Where access restriction apply, for compliance purpose, please provide you job title and business need when submitting your access request. This will help us process your request faster.

We've also got a dedicated SPA media channel, with walkthroughs on some of our commonly used apps. Check out the resources we've prepared to help you get started, including short 'how to videos' on our support page <insert URL:https://internal.kcl.ac.uk/about/ps/spa/analytics-data/support/Support>.

Best wishes, 
Analytics

name: Spoofing Incident - Resolution
content:
Hi,

Thank you for reporting this to us. 

For us to correctly investigate this for you we would first need the original copy of the email saved as an .EML file.

To do this please click on the email, navigate to File in the top left corner and select Save As,
Save the file in a familiar place as a Text Only (*.txt) file.
Once saved locate the file in file explorer and open it with Notepad,
with the file now open in notepad can you please navigate to File and then save as once more,
In the Save As dialogue, select All Files from Save as type drop-down list, then add .eml to the end of the file name

This will create a new copy of the email that allows our Cyber Security team to fully trace the email history and identify where it has come from.

We highly advise changing your password on your account to protect you from any more spoof emails while our security team look into this for you.
you can reset your password via the following link: https://passwordreset.kcl.ac.uk/default.aspx

For more information about phishing, please see the following intranet page: https://internal.kcl.ac.uk/it/security/Advice-and-Support/phishing.aspx

name: SPSS temporary license renewal - NON SOE
content:
Hello,

Thank you for contacting us regarding the renewal of SPSS.

I?m afraid that the renewal has still not taken place. This delay is due to the legal department querying some terms within the contract. Until this is completed, we will not be given the licence keys for SPSS for academic year 2021/2022. 

As our team are receiving many requests from users such as yourself requesting access or concerned they will lose access; we have requested temporary licence keys from SPSS to be made available to avoid anyone losing access. 

The temporary key is due to expire on the 1st October, they will then have another 1 month grace period before expiring once again. We hope the full license will be renewed by the 1st November, more information can be provided regarding the process closer to the time.


If you could kindly follow the step 1 or 2 below on how to update (depending on your installation status):

*THESE INSTRCUTIONS ARE FOR A PERSONAL DEVICE ONLY, IF YOU ARE USING A KCL SOE MACHINE, PLEASE LET US KNOW*

1. IF YOU HAVE AN EXISTING INSTALLTION
 
-Open SPSS on your device
-Go to OnTheHub -  https://kcl.onthehub.com/
-Navigate to 'Your Account/Orders'  
-Click 'Orders & Subscriptions' 
-Select SPSS from your order list 
-Click on 'View Details' 
-When prompted for an Activation code in SPSS copy/paste the red text 

 
2. IF YOU HAVE NOT INSTALLED SPSS FROM ONTHEHUB

-Go to OnTheHub -  https://kcl.onthehub.com/
-Select required version for your OS 
-Go through the payment process (you will NOT be charged).
-You will then be presented with the Download link and Activation Code. 
-Start to run the installation wizard.
-At the 'Product Authorization' window, please select the option Authorised User Licence (I purchased a single copy of the product).
-When prompted for an Activation code in SPSS copy/paste the red text 
 
Please advise if you encounter any issues by replying to this email with screenshots of any error messages. 

Kind Regards

name: SPSS temporary license renewal - SOE
content:
Hello,

Thank you for contacting us regarding the renewal of SPSS.

I?m afraid that the renewal has still not taken place. This delay is due to the legal department querying some terms within the contract. Until this is completed, we will not be given the licence keys for SPSS for academic year 2021/2022. 

As our team are receiving many requests from users such as yourself requesting access or concerned they will lose access; we have requested temporary licence keys from SPSS to be made available to avoid anyone losing access. 

The temporary key is due to expire on the 1st October, they will then have another 1 month grace period before expiring once again. We hope the full license will be renewed by the 1st November, more information can be provided regarding the process closer to the time.


If you could kindly follow the below steps on how to update the temporary license

*THESE INSTRCUTIONS ARE FOR A KCL DEVICE ONLY, IF YOU ARE USING A PERSONAL DEVICE PLEASE LET US KNOW*

- Please navigate to the Software Centre.
- Please then go to the 'Installation Status' page.
- From here, please click on SPSS and at the next screen select 'Uninstall'.
- Once your existing installation of SPSS has been uninstalled, please navigate to the 'Applications' tab.
- Please then search for SPSS if it is not immediately visible on the applications tab.
- Please then install SPSS again and the temporary key should be applied.

Please note, as the license keys are only temporary, you may still see messages regarding the expiration of the license. These warnings can be ignored as the application should work as intended.

Please advise if you encounter any issues by replying to this email with screenshots of any error messages. 

Kind Regards

name: Student Library Laptop Loan - Refer to SSO
content:
Hello,

Thank you for contacting the Service Desk,

For information on how to loan a library laptop please can you visit the self-service portal accessed via the following link: https://libanswers.kcl.ac.uk/faq/226855

Laptops are available in each library for use by King's students only.

They can be borrowed for up to 72 hours, with only one laptop on your account at any time.

Due to the specific software build on library laptops, and a need to retain these as a sustainable, short-term resource for all students, we cannot grant extended laptop loans (over 72 hours) for sitting examinations.

Laptops may be taken out of the library.

Note: If you intend to take a loan laptop off campus you will need to log on before leaving, otherwise you won't be able to use the laptop.

Late returns are charged at £5 per hour, or part thereof.


Please let us know if you have any questions or there is anything else we can do to help,
 
Kind regards,
 
It Service Desk

name: Teams - Cache Clear (Resolution MAC OS)
content:
Hello,

Thank you for the contacting the IT Service Desk.

In order to resolve this issue, please could you follow the below steps for your MAC OS device.

1. Quit out of Teams completely.
2. Navigate to the finder application and search ~/Library/Application Support/Microsoft.
3. Right-click the Teams folder then select Move to Trash.
4. Navigate to Keychain Access.
5. Search for ?Microsoft Teams? and delete the entries found.
Open Teams and wait for it to load completely.
Please be aware this can take a few minutes.

If you have done this and continue to experience issues, please get back to us, providing a screen shot if possible, and we will reopen the ticket to investigate further.

Kind Regards

IT Service Desk

name: Teams - Cache Clear (Resolution Windows)
content:
Thank you for contacting the IT Service Desk.

In order to resolve this issue, please could you follow the below steps for Windows devices:

1. Quit Microsoft Teams (Right click Teams on taskbar icon, select Quit)

2. Cut and paste the following location into File Explorer: %appdata%\Microsoft

3. Delete the contents of the entire Teams folder.

4. Restart Microsoft Teams.

If you have done this and continue to experience issues, please get back to us, providing a screen shot if possible, and we will reopen the ticket.

Kind Regards,
IT Service Desk

name: Teams - Restore Deleted Files
content:
Hello, 

Thank you for contacting Service Desk.

To recover files deleted from Microsoft teams, please refer to the guidance below;

Open the channel's Files tab and select 'Open in SharePoint' at the top of the page.
In SharePoint, select Recycle bin on the left side of the page. 
This will show a list of all files deleted from every channel in the team.
Select the file (or files) you want to recover and then select Restore at the top of the page.

Kind Regards,

IT Service Desk

name: Telephony Troubleshoot (Analogue/digital)
content:
Extension number that is faulty:

What is the fault? Dead line / one way transmission / unable to make or receive calls etc.

Have they tried using a different handset in the same socket?

Make and model of handset:

If checks done on analogue phone, but issue persists, record the following information

Name of the person who's extension it is:

Extension number: 

Socket number:

Alternative contact number:

Cost Code and Location details should be recorded in the relevant sections below.

Telephony DO NOT provide new Analogue handsets, these are ordered via Kcep. No NEW Analogue extensions will be allocated. All NEW extensions will be VOIP.

name: Telephony Troubleshoot (Voip Phone)- Aastra or Mitel
content:
Please follow Telephony Troubleshooting guide here : https://emckclac.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/ESMdsd/KB/Telephony/Telephony%20Troubleshooting%20NEW.docx?d=wc6eb16806aba4208af8b33d4d2152f9b&csf=1&web=1&e=TCGSTh

-	Have they tried logging on successfully to another VoIP phone?

-	We need the extension number that is faulty, the wall port it?s plugged into and the MAC Address, which is located on the back of the phone.

-	We need location details including room and building.

-	If the VoIP phone is having boot up issues (I.e. it tries to boot, but doesn?t get to the login screen), then pass it to networks to get the port config checked in the first instance with MAC address of computer and IP address

-	If the VoIP phone says no service, try logging in with extension number 

-       Remove the network cable from the back of phone and wall and reconnect to see if service resumes.

-	If none of the above work we need a detailed description of what the fault they are experiencing is:

Name of person who's extension is affected:

Extension number:

Alternative contact number.

MAC Address of phone:

Socket Number:

Please put Cost-Code and Location details in the correct location further down the form.

name: Unable to login/Domain not available - Windows SOE
content:
Customers need to be connected to the internet before they login to an SOE for the first time. Please check the customer has connected to their local Wi-Fi, eduroam or the wired network.

Not being connected to the network will result in a login error message of 'We are unable to sign you in as your domain is unavailable'.

Connecting to the network will normally resolve this issue however if they are still getting this message, check / try the following :

- Open the Network list and check if it mentioned 'KCL - Direct Access' 
- Try restarting the device.

If Direct Access appears in the network list or the restart doesn't resolve the issue, the device will need to be escalated to EUS BAU.

Other sign in errors can include the following :

- Password incorrect (suggest resetting on a different device)
- Username incorrect (knumber / knumber@kcl.ac.uk)
- Account expired (check MIM)
- Account locked (Check AD > Account > Unlock account).

Check the account's status in MIM and AD Data Checker and ask the customer to try and login to a service on a different device. 

If unable to login on the laptop only, gather details and escalate to EUS. If unable to access other services on different devices, it will likely be an account issue and will need to be looked at by yourself / collab.

name: Vodafone - Manual Roam
content:
A manual roam refreshes your connection to the network and can also resolve network issues, such as being unable to make/receive calls or send text messages/emails. To complete a manual roam, follow the steps below: 



? From Apps 



? Select Settings 



? Under Networks 



? Select More 



? Select More/Mobile Networks 



? Select Network/Network Operators 



? Change Search mode to Manual 



? Change the Network Selection Mode from 'Automatic' to 'Manual', the phone will then scan for other available networks 



? Select a different network, i.e. EE (you will see an error message to advise you will have 'emergency calls only') 



? Please change Network Selection Mode back to Automatic, this will bring you back to Vodafone or your preferred network.

name: Vodafone - Signal Issues
content:
A manual roam/ swapping the sims between devices is usually the best first line troubleshooting available to an analyst when a user experiences issues with their device. 

This can be found as an email template titled Vodafone - Manual Roam, and this should be applied in the first instance to see if this resolves the no signal issue for the user in question.

As well as this, please also advise for the user to try unplugging/ replugging the SIM into another device, to see if their wifi signal works in any other devices. (This will then allow you to identify if the fault is with the device or SIM in question).

If the above steps don't resolve the issue for the user in question, please then gather the SIM number/ mobile number of the device in question, and identify the users DTC (Departmental Telephone Co-ordinator). 

In the first instance, this should then be raised with the DTC for their assistance to resolution with the Vodafone. If the DTC is unable to action this, the IT Service Desk would then assist with contacting the regional helpdesk found at regional@help.vodafone.co.uk.

name: Vodafone - SIM Swap
content:
In the first instance, this should then be raised with the DTC for their assistance to resolution with the Vodafone. If the DTC is unable to action this, the IT Service Desk would then assist with swapping this SIM as needed via VCO.

Please see the following runbook for further information on this process - https://emckclac.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/ESMdsd/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B07920EF7-588B-4638-A9C7-3CF88BCC9AFB%7D&file=Everything%20Vodafone.docx&action=default&mobileredirect=true - under the subtitle Registering SIM cards

name: Web Room Booking - Max Concurrent Users
content:
Hello,

Thank you for contacting the Service Desk.

We are currently aware of issues affecting the performance of Web Room Booking and this has been logged under problem record: PR1754.

We are working on resolving this issue has a high priority. 

Please find some guidance below on using the system in the meantime: 

The system is currently used less before 9:30 am and between noon and 2pm so is more accessible at these times.

When you have finished using the system please log straight out as this will increase the performance of the system for other users.

When you click ?next? there is sometimes a delay, please do not click next again as this will cause extra load on the system decreasing the performance.

name: WorkTribe - Incident
content:
Is customer able to log into WorkTribe?
If Yes, please refer them onto their Business Administrator in the first instance.
If No, continue troubleshooting.
 
Is the issue affecting multiple users?
If Yes, assign to Education Applications.
If No, continue troubleshooting.
 
Has user been able to access WorkTribe before?
If No, check that they are in the WorkTribe AD Group for access. If they are not in the group, refer them to their Business Administrator for their access request to be processed.
If Yes, continue troubleshooting.
 
Error message user is receiving (include screen shot)
 
Details of 1st Line Troubleshooting undertaken, e.g. reboot device, try on another machine, check AD account is not locked and password is still current
 
If the issue is outside of the Service Desk?s remit to resolve, copy all information into an email to the relevant Business Administrator (from within the ticket) and resolve.

name: WPM - Compromised Card Data P2
content:

?	a King's hosted website that includes card payment processing, seems to have been compromised

If this occurs:
?	an incident needs to be raised as a P2
